items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Solutions Architect, Pre-Sales, Enterprise Networking, CCIE, Cisco R/S, SDN

A Leading Technology Solutions Provider specialized in deploying Security, Voice over IP, Cloud Solutions and other Advanced Networking solutions and services to regional & national Commercial, Healthcare and Enterprise clients has immediate needs for several Senior Pre-Sales Systems Engineers / Solutions Architects.

As the Senior Pre-Sales Solutions Architect, the candidate will be responsible for meeting with Commercial and Enterprise customers, collecting requirements for Core Networking Solutions relating to network projects and developing engineering Solutions for sale to customers. This is a technical sales support role for our account management team. Your ability to clearly articulate enterprise network solutions to our existing customer base and prospects is essential.

***This will be a Lead role for the region and offers the ability to work remotely from home when not in front of clients.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Remote from home when not in front of clients
- Opportunity to join a practice that is is rapid growth mode
- Competitive compensation packages
- Relocation assistance is offered!
- Work with established Cisco Gold Partners

What You Will Be Doing

The essential responsibilities of the Senior Systems Engineer are to work directly with customers and account managers in pre-sales situations, and to work effectively across functions with other employees in Sales, Marketing, Proposals, and Project Management areas. Specific responsibilities include:

- Perform as a Pre Sales Solutions Architect while also being the SME in Networking technologies for enterprise clients
- Meet with Customers and Collect Customer Requirements
- Work with Account Manager/Sales Team to develop customer relationship and Solutions and assist in overall sales process
- Create high-level solution designs/Architecture and present to customers
- Create Customer facing Presentations
- Create Bill of Materials & configurations for Solutions
- Build Scope of Services and Professional Service Pricing
- Write Statements of Work

What You Need for this Position

- Experience working as a Pre-sales Solution Architect or Cisco Sales Engineer
- 5+ years of experience in a network or solutions engineering level role that includes route/switch, Cisco wireless and Cisco Nexus
- Strong Pre Sales Experience
- Active CCNP and/ or CCIE certifications are highly desired
- Experience with Cisco Security, Data Center and/ or Collaboration are a plus
- Designing network solutions for enterprise customers
- Ability to deliver well-crafted and detailed Statements of Work
- Ability to deliver accurate Bills of Materials in short time frames
- Proven experience of successful solution selling
- Proven presentation and sales skills
- Must be able to quickly learn several products across a wide range of enterprise and data center networking technologies

What's In It for You

- Relocation Assistance!
- Competitive Base Salary (DOE)
- Work remote from home when no in front of clients
- Minimal travel
- Comprehensive Benefits Package
- PTO
- Opportunity for growth
- 401k
- Great work environment
- Other cool perks!If you are an experienced Sr. Network Solutions Architect, you are encouraged to apply ASAP or you can send your resume to me directly at

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

items.title: Data Architect/Solution Architect - REMOTE
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
This is a full-time permanent work from home Solutions/Data Architect who has a desire to work for a database software company in a post-sales role in their professional services division, working with customers and clients REMOTLEY. The appeal is quality of life, work from home and still able to work in professional services and not be a road warrior. Most professional services organizations have their employees traveling Monday Friday each week, that is not the case here.

About the Company:

Our client is a company you will know of well. They make a database. The difference is that they are a key value database, NOSQL Database, and they offer the lowest total cost of ownership among any database competitors out there, they give you performance at scale.

All industries that need access to real time data (we are talking 100 s of terabytes). One customer (as an example), was using a competitor (an opensource product), they had 30 terabytes of data, they had 500 servers that they needed to run their data. But when our client looked at the problem and modeled it out they only needed 60 servers and we were faster in returning data, basically 10 millisecond read type operations. The deployment ended up being 43 servers vs 500 competitor servers. The customer saved on an operational basis 2 million dollars a year. Those operational costs were big, and their performance is better than any other databases. It is a hot technology, and this is why they are growing.

They put a strong emphasis on making sure their software architecture and their database architecture are correct so it can scale. They have customers that come in and start with 10 terabytes and 12 months later they are running a 100-200 terabytes of data, so that architecture has to be able to scale and so there is a lot of data modeling that goes into that, there is a lot of understanding software design patterns.

Profile:

The best people for this job would be Data Architects, Database Architects or Senior Data Engineers who have realized they are really good with helping customers succeed. It would be easy to just hire a technical person for this role, but often times they don t put enough thought into methodology for customer success or they don t really enjoy running customer projects.

The level of this role is architecture level (high level e.g. Solutions Architect). We are looking for systems design, understanding the end to end software development process and all the pieces, people who have run projects including running the development, the DevOps, the design, the BA stuff, etc.

NOSQL experience would be nice to have. is important because the way our client solves the use case in NOSQL is so different than in the relational world and people who haven t been exposed to how they model the data in NOSQL, there is just a learning curve that we want someone to have already gone through.

If someone doesn t have DevOps/operations side, it wouldn t be a deal killer. But if they understand general DevOps pipelines, all the tools that are play in that space, Kubernetes, Chef, Puppet, Ansible, that would be nice. The reason is that they are working with their customers to deploy into their infrastructure and their customers are using these tools and you need to help them understand how to fit the software into those landscapes and into those pipelines and that is part of what they do for our customers.

Day in Life:

Some of what you will do once a customer is onboarded is to indentify metrics, what they are trying to accomplish, their objectives, you introduce them to the training functions, you design a training program, meaning you look at their job function and figure out what courses in the course catalogue they need to take and make sure they complete their product certification. Next, you ADOPT the sofware into their production environment. There are 8 steps that take place: Software architecture review, data model exercise, capacity planning exercise, there is a number of things that go through on architecture and similarly on the DevOps side. There is a checklist of things that include looking at their pipeline, advising how to write scripts if they are using something like ansible, how do they script into our software, what are the recommendations, what are the best practices, you look at their disaster recovery plans, how are they backing up data, how are they restoring it, how are they testing that, then you go into the testing side, which is functional tests, performance tests, how they are going to validate if the software is up and working, all those things occur when they launch, and you are that technical resource to make sure all those things are done right.

Other companies call this a Technical Account Manager. If you have been a TAM you will understand what they do and how they work. You work with that customer team every week, work on operations issue, architecture issues, you are a liaison between support, you build relationships with customers, you are one of the reason why the customer expands because they know you are there to help them answer questions and ensure they are successful. It is a strong consultant who can play that role well.

The data experience is good, but it is more important that they understand these enterprise software systems and how they operate with each other. And multi-database, we aren t just looking for some MySQL or some web applications, it s actual different databases, enterprise databases, NoSQL, etc.

If someone has Cassandra, that would be great because that s scale. Or if we could find people with NoSQL or Cloud: CouchDB, MongoDB, Redis, Cosmos DB, DynamoDB.

- provided by Dice

items.title: Senior Developer Advocate
items.content:
Senior Developer Advocate

Developer
Anywhere in US
Company: Amazon
Full Time

Overview

***Note: Location for this role is flexible within the USA***

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a talented, self-directed Sr. Developer Advocate to drive adoption and community engagement AWS App Mesh. In addition to App Mesh, the Container Services team builds and operates services such as Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS), Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR), and AWS Fargate, that make it easy for customers to run container based applications and microservices in production. In this role, you’ll combine your passion and enthusiasm for developers with your unmatched creativity to generate grass-roots attention and support for container technology among developers, technologists, and key industry opinion makers.

Ideally, you are someone who can write code with the best of them, but get great satisfaction from guiding developers and enterprises towards a technology you strongly believe in. You have immediate credibility with developers evidenced by your following on mediums such as GitHub, Twitter, and Medium, but are equally comfortable working with decision makers at large enterprises. You love to share your passion with others and exhibit good judgment in selecting strategic opportunities to do so. You don’t just want to be part of an industry movement, you want to be out front leading it.

Your responsibilities will include:
  • Delivering compelling presentations, product demos, sample solutions, and discussions to drive adoption of App Mesh and other container technologies
  • Actively participating in service mesh and related open source projects and being a member of the open source community
  • Collaborating with internal teams to identify product gaps and define new features/services, influence the product roadmap, market positioning, and developer program initiatives
  • Creating webcasts, running Twitch office hours, and developing tutorials about emerging technologies and industry developments
  • Maintaining a strong and credible presence in social media and technology channels relevant to developers
  • Representing AWS/Containers/App Mesh as a panelist/keynote speaker at meetups, and relevant technology/industry conferences

    • BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
    • Bachelors degree or higher in computer science, engineering, or a related discipline
    • 7+ years in the technology industry in a technical, product management, or evangelism/developer advocacy role
    • 5+ years as a software development engineer or devops engineer
    • 2+ years hands on experience with Linux containers, in particular docker and kubernetes
    • Superior oral and written communication skills, including public speaking
    • The ability to work cooperatively with, and gain the respect of, software developers is a must
    • A willingness to work remotely, autonomously, and travel are a must

      • PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
      • Masters degree or higher in computer science, engineering, or a related discipline.
      • Active contributor to open source projects
      • 2+ years hands on experience with container management platforms
      • Experience with service mesh technologies
      • 2+ years speaking at technology conferences, meetups to a technical audience with high scores
      • Demonstrable following in social and technical channels such as Twitter, YouTube, GitHub, and Twitch
        • Apply for job

items.content:
Is your career as a consultant ready to be super-charged? At Innovien Solutions, we re in the business of placing technology consultants who out-work, out-think and over-deliver. If you re ready to work with the best clients in the industry, we re ready to match you with the top people in the business.

As an Innovien Solutions consultant, you ll help businesses solve the most pressing technology challenges of today. We re looking for consultants with capability and character... people with the drive, desire and determination to dream big, but do bigger. You ll like working with us because we ll go to bat for you, working tirelessly on your behalf. Best of all, we only work with the highest quality clients to ensure your experience is nothing short of top-notch.

*LONG TERM OPPORUTNITY - REMOTE* We are currently looking for a hands-on AWS Cloud Engineer for a large cloud implementation project with a global Fortune 50 client of ours. The ideal candidate will have a solid AWS background in an enterprise environment with strong Linux knowledge/experience. APPLY TODAY if this sounds like you!

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must have U.S. Citizenship
  • Must be willing to work Eastern Time zone
  • 2+ years solid AWS cloud and infrastructure experience
  • Strong Linux/Windows OS experience
  • Database and development experience, as well as deployment experience
  • Automation experience (Python, PowerShell, Bash, Chef, Puppet, etc.) working with configuration management tools
  • Enterprise experience

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Cloud engineering, OS hardening, Linux administration, desired state management, service development, sustaining engineering, monitoring, deployments, running servers, etc. They will also do some T3 and T4 support for users, make sure systems are secure, etc.

- provided by Dice

items.title: Solution Architect (Telecom / BSS / OSS) - Telecommuting/Remote
items.content:
Telecommuting/remote position

Position Summary:

The Solution Architect position exists to manage, gather, and process information related to CHR Business Support Systems (BSS) and Operational Support Systems (OSS) so that CHR products integrate with devices on the client service delivery network. This position ensures Client satisfaction in the initial solution design, provides client guidance, captures technical requirements, and obtains Client acceptance of the technical solution. Incumbent will successfully meet or exceed business unit goals while maintaining quality standards, controlling expenses, and following company and business unit directives and practices.

Primary Accountabilities:

  • Lead the Technical aspect of developing Client specific, tactical and strategic component architecture of B/OSS systems and technologies, including all CHR product offerings and integrated systems, ensuring that designs, architectures, and solutions satisfy all product, project and business requirements
  • Communicate the architectural vision to the Client and the activations and development teams
  • Assist in the planning and design of new or upgraded systems (conversion)
  • Identify, assess and document advising stakeholders on options and risks
  • Assist Sales Organization in Statement of Work research and preparation
  • Identify and document what the B/OSS systems, process or product/service must do in order to fulfill the business, functional and non-functional requirements
  • Lead in the evolution of product and system roadmaps tactical and strategic component architecture designs will be in compliance with company direction
  • Identify and assist the team in communicating action items that result from the information gathering throughout the CHR Solutions organization, including Product Management
  • Manage pre-and post-release expectations
  • Conduct research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business unit, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible
  • Ability to travel up to 50% by car and/or plane, may include weekend travel; ability to travel internationally is required for some positions. Current passport and valid driver s license required.

Scope:

Scope of Projects worked on will range from small integration or enhancement projects with project costs as low as $20,000 to large implementation projects related to our OSS/BSS solutions that have multi-million dollar project costs.

Primary scope ranges are below:

  • Software Activation Projects average a total deal value of $750,000 up to $2.5 million for larger projects
  • Total Gross Revenue for Software Activation clients averages $9 million to $250 million for larger clients
  • The average number of customer accounts converted per Software Activation Project is 15,000 for an average client to 175,000 for larger clients
  • The average number of data elements which must be mapped, converted and validate range from 2,500 to 17,000.

Education and Experience Requirements:

Education:

  • Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Systems, or related degree preferred
  • Equivalent combination of education and experience accepted

Experience:

  • Ten or more years of experience in telecommunications operations
  • Five or more years of experience with BSS/OSS systems and reporting tools
  • Two or more years of experience in solution architecture
  • Two or more years of experience in telecommunications network (LAN, MAN and WAN) and associated protocols
  • Knowledge of 7 layer OSI and 5 layer TMN models
  • Knowledge of SOA, SOAP, XML, WSDL, UDDI
  • TM Forum Certification (eTOM, NGOSS, SID, TAM, etc.) preferred but knowledge essential
  • Ability to create LLD and HLD documents from Use Cases
  • Ability to create simple SQL reports
  • Knowledge of software development process and methodologies
  • Project Management experience is preferred
  • Experience with Use Case Development and/or UML preferred
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interact at all levels of the organization
  • Ability to effectively utilize MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Outlook). Experience with MS Project preferred

ADA Requirements:

General office environment: Work is generally sedentary in nature, but may require standing and walking for up to 10% of the time. The working environment is generally favorable. Lighting and temperature are adequate, and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc. Work is generally performed within an office environment, with standard office equipment available.

Physical Demands: Manipulate, handle, feel, and control items or equipment; able to read, write, and interpret written documents; occasionally lift and move objects weighing up to 25 pounds.

- provided by Dice

items.title: Senior Cloud Architect - Azure (virtual remote home office eligible)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Description

The Senior Cloud Architect leads the planning, design, and engineering of enterprise-level infrastructure and platforms related to cloud computing. The Senior Cloud Architect work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Responsibilities

Responsibilities
The Senior Cloud Architect performs technical planning, architecture development and modification of specifications for cloud computing environments. Develops specifications for new IT cloud computing products and service offerings. Assesses the compatibility and integration of products/services proposed as standards in order to ensure an integrated architecture across interdependent technologies. Begins to influence department?s strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.
We are seeking a Cloud Technical Architect with extensive experience working in a complex computing environment to join our internal Virtualization and Infrastructure team. As a Cloud Technical Architect, you will work as part of a team that designs and architects Humana?s next generation internal and external cloud infrastructure. A thorough understanding of and working experience with an Enterprise computing infrastructure and cloud computing technologies are required. To be successful you will need a strong technical orientation; be a creative problem solver; be motivated to advance in the field; and work well in a team-oriented environment.
Job Responsibilities
  • Design, build and deploy Cloud solutions across Humana?s Azure tenant

items.title: Workgrid Solutions Architect - Remote
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
As an endeavor of Liberty Mutual, Workgrid Software is changing the way enterprise software is built. Our mission is to create beautiful purpose-built software that focuses on improving the employee experience.

At Workgrid, we believe employees should be productive, not busy. The amount of systems in today's business environment is overwhelming the workforce. Employees are overloaded with information, spending hours checking and managing their work, finding information, and taking action on menial tasks. This is causing significant communication and productivity issues in the workplace.

Workgrid focuses on creating solutions that solve the most common and inefficient workplace technology challenges faced by mid-large global businesses. Everything we do is because we believe people have a purpose. We create intuitive experiences that enable human potential by building software that people love.

Workgrid is actively seeking a Solutions Architect who will be responsible for developing a strong technical understanding of the Workgrid platform and leading the solution approach for onboarding external customers. Workgrid is on an AWS platform, node Back End, serverless, multi-tenant, and global. Standards of SAML and OIDC are used. Microapps use web technologies such as HTML and JavaScript with a node Back End. You will be the technical lead working with the customers technical lead to set up, deploy, provision, and connect the customers systems (modern SaaS to Legacy) using web services such as REST and SOAP to create a meaningful and engaging employee experience.

You will also be responsible for establishing reusable patterns whenever possible and providing thought-leadership to the Product team, as well as product recommendations that enable the customers. Develop specifications for new features. Hands-on approach but may also mentor and guide other team members on the execution of the strategy. Identify and fill gaps to enable the customer to be self-sufficient on the platform. This could be through additional documentation or recommendations to the Product team on the core platform.

The actual internal level/grade for this role will depend on the candidates overall experience and skill level. Ability to Work Remote anywhere in the Continental United States.

About the role:

  • Technical Lead Architect who will develop the solution approach for onboarding new customers to the Workgrid platform.
  • Provide technical mentorship to the customer to teach them how to use the product and become self-sufficient.
  • Provides oversight on the execution of the architectural approach to onboarding customers. Influence and ensure solutions follow leading guidelines, are scalable, and whenever possible re-usable for other customers.
  • Designs and develops IT architecture (deployment, provisioning users, connectors) scalable solutions to business problems in alignment with the Workgrid architecture direction and standards.
  • Provides consultation and collaborates with Head of Product, CEO, and Head of Customer Success regarding long and short-range product features.
  • Recommends and drives innovative solutions, which anticipates the future direction of the business, its drivers and technology strategy.
  • Provides consultation on leveraging new and existing software and technology.
  • Leads teams, may have overall leadership responsibility for product architecture and design.
  • Reviews and ensures major architectural designs are consistent, maintainable, flexible and cost effective solutions.
  • Works with or leads technical teams to identify functional requirements that drive architecture and technology to meet customer needs and enables business capability.
  • Participates with application and infrastructure design architects to provide guidance for development and releases.
  • Develops strategies and architectures which support advanced security topics such as Vulnerability Lifecycle Management, Identity Management, Intrusion Detection, Authentication, Authorization and Auditing.
  • Consults with application development and infrastructure development teams to fit systems to architecture, and identify when it is necessary to modify the technical architecture to accommodate customer/stakeholder needs.
  • Responsible for prototyping complex, cross platform business solutions to validate newer technologies.
  • Recommends emerging scalable and reusable technical solutions to increase market share and reduce operational costs.
  • Analyzes the technology industry and market trends to determine potential impact on the business.
  • Influences technology direction and/or adjustments to incorporate into business plans.
  • Influences the selection of hardware and software product standards and the design of standard configurations; makes significant contributions to Product technology roadmaps and architectural principles and frameworks.
  • Develops and manages effective collaborative relationships with other departments, groups, peers, and subordinates (data mgmt., security, and infrastructure).
  • Leads retrospectives and defining opportunities for experiments and POCs.
  • Facilitates cross-team/train learnings, communication and alignment.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors or Masters degree in technical discipline; Masters preferred.
  • 10+ years of architecture experience in applications development in a complex, multi-platform distributed environment.
  • Extensive experience in layered solutions and designs, diverse technical configurations, across multiple technologies and processing environments.
  • In-depth knowledge in software engineering languages and tools; proficient in new and emerging technologies.
  • Extensive knowledge of all product and system components of technical architecture.
  • In-depth understanding of business operations, objectives and strategies including but not limited to, insurance industry, financial services, global business, architecture, technology trends, as well as security minded.
  • Strong leadership skills; coaching and mentoring skills. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills - including negotiation, facilitation, and consensus building skills; ability to influence and persuade, without direct control.
  • High degree of flexibility and ability to work with employees at all levels of the organization with diverse backgrounds.
  • Strong desire to drive change, and ability to adapt to change quickly. Strong consulting skills (relevant/technical); recognized as a thought leader within the company. Ability to balance the long-term "big picture" and short term implications of decisions.

Benefits:

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, its our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace an environment that is free from all discrimination in the workplace, in its business, or by its vendors. Liberty Mutual values diversity and the differences and similarities of our employees. We foster a diverse and inclusive work environment that leads to better ideas, stronger teams and more innovative products and services for our customers. Learn more

Liberty Mutual will consider for employment qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of federal, state, and local laws.

items.title: Senior Cloud Architect - Azure (virtual remote home office eligible)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Description

The Senior Cloud Architect leads the planning, design, and engineering of enterprise-level infrastructure and platforms related to cloud computing. The Senior Cloud Architect work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities

The Senior Cloud Architect performs technical planning, architecture development and modification of specifications for cloud computing environments. Develops specifications for new IT cloud computing products and service offerings. Assesses the compatibility and integration of products/services proposed as standards in order to ensure an integrated architecture across interdependent technologies. Begins to influence department's strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.

We are seeking a Cloud Technical Architect with extensive experience working in a complex computing environment to join our internal Virtualization and Infrastructure team. As a Cloud Technical Architect, you will work as part of a team that designs and architects Humana's next generation internal and external cloud infrastructure. A thorough understanding of and working experience with an Enterprise computing infrastructure and cloud computing technologies are required. To be successful you will need a strong technical orientation; be a creative problem solver; be motivated to advance in the field; and work well in a team-oriented environment.

Job Responsibilities

  • Design, build and deploy Cloud solutions across Humana's Azure tenant
  • Design automation of infrastructure as a Service and capabilities including virtual networks, virtual machines, cloud services, web sites, data services, IOT, etc.
  • Lead technical deployments that involve multiple IT teams and stakeholders
  • Provide technical direction to meet the internal needs
  • Develop, enhance, orchestration and automation of cloud enablement tools
  • Design a highly scalable and redundant virtual infrastructure to support the company's future growth
  • Provide innovative suggestions for complex implementation solutions
  • Create documentation and implementation plans to allow support teams to build and manage the internal cloud environment
  • Stay abreast of current technologies and make recommendations based on knowledge and research

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years of Azure experience designing and supporting large scale environments
  • 5+ years of hands on experience supporting Enterprise computing infrastructure and virtualization computing technologies
  • Solid architecture & design experience in using virtualization technologies
  • Established experience with automated, elastic scaling of cloud services, automated deployment and remediation
  • Ability to prioritize projects and deliverables
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively as well as independently to support deadlines
  • Demonstrate ability to use problem solving techniques such as root cause analysis to resolve issues
  • Demonstrate ability to write and present effective materials, including presentations, status reporting, technical diagrams and flowcharts
  • Ability to follow and adhere to policies, procedures and standards relating to network and systems management
  • Prepare detailed build/test plans to implement new technologies and configurations
  • Ability to collaborate with a team working across multiple locations

    Preferred Qualifications

  • Azure Certification is strongly preferred
  • A track record of success developing and deploying creative technical solutions to business problems for or within large enterprise organizations
  • Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field
  • Experience with the design and development of cloud-native, secure, distributed applications
  • Knowledge with modern service hosting, security, and risk management concerns such as IAM, access control, monitoring, IaaS/PaaS/SaaS, and containers
  • Knowledge of infrastructure automation through DevOps scripting and configuration management
  • Working knowledge of designing high availability systems in the cloud (fault domains, availability zones, deployment slots, regions)
  • Experience developing ARM Templates, Cloud formation templates, or Terraform
  • Networking fundamentals, including VPN, security, and WAN concepts
  • Experience using Source Control (GIt, TFVC, etc.)
  • Experience with infrastructure Configuration tools (DSC, Puppet or Chef)
  • Knowledge of Cloud Database fundamentals (Azure SQL, MS SQL)
  • Experience working in an agile continuous delivery workflow & team
  • Experience communicating technical complexity and change to a broad spectrum of stakeholders
  • Experience with technical writing and documentation

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

  • Knowledge of infrastructure automation through DevOps scripting and configuration management
  • Working knowledge of designing high availability systems in the cloud (fault domains, availability zones, deployment slots, regions)

  • Networking fundamentals, including VPN, security, and WAN concepts
  • Experience using Source Control (GIt, TFVC, etc.)
  • Experience with infrastructure Configuration tools (DSC, Puppet, Chef)
  • Knowledge of Cloud Database fundamentals (MySQL, RDS, DynamoDB, CosmosDB, MongoDB)

items.title: Lead Network Solutions Architect (Remote w/ Travel)
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Solutions Architect, Pre-Sales, Enterprise Networking, CCIE, Cisco R/S, SDN

A Leading Technology Solutions Provider specialized in deploying Security, Voice over IP, Cloud Solutions and other Advanced Networking solutions and services to regional & national Commercial, Healthcare and Enterprise clients has immediate needs for several Senior Pre-Sales Systems Engineers / Solutions Architects.

As the Senior Pre-Sales Solutions Architect, the candidate will be responsible for meeting with Commercial and Enterprise customers, collecting requirements for Core Networking Solutions relating to network projects and developing engineering Solutions for sale to customers. This is a technical sales support role for our account management team. Your ability to clearly articulate enterprise network solutions to our existing customer base and prospects is essential.

***This will be a Lead role for the region and offers the ability to work remotely from home when not in front of clients.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Remote from home when not in front of clients
- Opportunity to join a practice that is is rapid growth mode
- Competitive compensation packages
- Relocation assistance is offered!
- Work with established Cisco Gold Partners

items.title: Presales Solution Engineer (Remote based in U.S.)
items.content:
At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way.

As a Presales Solution Engineer for Pitney Bowes, you can too.

We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components: Client. Team. Win. Innovate.


We actively look for prospects who:

-Are passionate about client success.

-Enjoy collaborating with others.

-Strive to exceed expectations.

-Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutions.

You are:

Passionate about technology. A client focused individual who has the ability to present the value of our solutions to clients while advancing sales opportunities. You are a forward thinker who acts with purposefulness and is committed to championing new ideas and creativity. You will assist with sales opportunities for products and solutions in our Customer Information Management line of business.

You will:

-Provide deal execution support through subject matter expertise in PB Software solutions.

-Actively participate in opportunity discovery and sales strategy sessions.

-Analyze stakeholders, identify and recognize prospect traits and determine how to effectively influence their decision.

-Build and perform prospect relevant presentations and solution demonstrations, delivered in-person and remotely.

-Participate in scoping and executing client Proofs of Concept (POCs).

-Support demand generation efforts and provide staffing for marketing events.

-Actively participate in after sale transition to consulting services.

-Contribute to written proposals and RFP responses.

-Stay current on industry / technical trends, developments.

Your background:

As a Presales Solution Engineer, you have:

-5+ years of experience in enterprise software Presales.

-Experience and strong desire to work in a dynamic, responsive, fast-paced sales organization.

-Comfort and confidence interacting with customers and delivering formal presentations, to management and executive, C-level audiences.

-Ability to rapidly assimilate and distill complex information.

-Ability to demonstrate the value of a solution (not demonstrate functionality) to advance the sale.

-Ability to build a strong working relationship and credibility with both the prospect and the PB Software opportunity team.

-Strong sense of teamwork, integrity, self-motivation and positive attitude.

-Ability to travel up to 50% including overnight travel

-Strong domain expertise highly preferred in Data Quality, Big Data, Single Customer View, Data Analytics

-Understanding of Web-based application architectures and Mapping domain expertise a plus

-Installation and scripting experience with common platforms / languages a plus


We will:

-Provide the opportunity to grow and develop your career

-Offer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspectives and ideas

-Deliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of a transforming organization

-Offer comprehensive benefits globally (pbprojectliving.com)

Our Team

Our Software and Data Solutions team powers global commerce, processing billions of transactions every year. Our Software technology and solutions help businesses operate faster and more efficiently. How? By identifying trusted data and insights to create targeted, effective messaging, by providing accurate geographic data to make smarter business decisions, and by delivering relevant and engaging interactions across the customer lifecycle to drive increased satisfaction.

Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace.

W/M/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/LGBT are encouraged to apply.

All interested individuals must apply online. Individuals with disabilities who cannot apply via our online application should refer to the alternate application options via our Individuals with Disabilities link.-



- provided by Dice

items.content:
As an endeavor of Liberty Mutual, Workgrid Software is changing the way enterprise software is built. Our mission is to create beautiful purpose-built software that focuses on improving the employee experience.

At Workgrid, we believe employees should be productive, not busy. The amount of systems in today's business environment is overwhelming the workforce. Employees are overloaded with information, spending hours checking and managing their work, finding information, and taking action on menial tasks. This is causing significant communication and productivity issues in the workplace.

Workgrid focuses on creating solutions that solve the most common and inefficient workplace technology challenges faced by mid-large global businesses. Everything we do is because we believe people have a purpose. We create intuitive experiences that enable human potential by building software that people love.

Workgrid is actively seeking a Solutions Architect who will be responsible for developing a strong technical understanding of the Workgrid platform and leading the solution approach for onboarding external customers. Workgrid is on an AWS platform, node back end, serverless, multi-tenant, and global. Standards of SAML and OIDC are used. Microapps use web technologies such as HTML and JavaScript with a node backend. You will be the technical lead working with the customers technical lead to set up, deploy, provision, and connect the customers systems (modern SaaS to legacy) using web services such as REST and SOAP to create a meaningful and engaging employee experience.

You will also be responsible for establishing reusable patterns whenever possible and providing thought-leadership to the Product team, as well as product recommendations that enable the customers. Develop specifications for new features. Hands-on approach but may also mentor and guide other team members on the execution of the strategy. Identify and fill gaps to enable the customer to be self-sufficient on the platform. This could be through additional documentation or recommendations to the Product team on the core platform.

The actual internal level/grade for this role will depend on the candidates overall experience and skill level. Ability to Work Remote anywhere in the Continental United States.

About the role:

  • Technical Lead Architect who will develop the solution approach for onboarding new customers to the Workgrid platform.
  • Provide technical mentorship to the customer to teach them how to use the product and become self-sufficient.
  • Provides oversight on the execution of the architectural approach to onboarding customers. Influence and ensure solutions follow leading guidelines, are scalable, and whenever possible re-usable for other customers.
  • Designs and develops IT architecture (deployment, provisioning users, connectors) scalable solutions to business problems in alignment with the Workgrid architecture direction and standards.
  • Provides consultation and collaborates with Head of Product, CEO, and Head of Customer Success regarding long and short-range product features.
  • Recommends and drives innovative solutions, which anticipates the future direction of the business, its drivers and technology strategy.
  • Provides consultation on leveraging new and existing software and technology.
  • Leads teams, may have overall leadership responsibility for product architecture and design.
  • Reviews and ensures major architectural designs are consistent, maintainable, flexible and cost effective solutions.
  • Works with or leads technical teams to identify functional requirements that drive architecture and technology to meet customer needs and enables business capability.
  • Participates with application and infrastructure design architects to provide guidance for development and releases.
  • Develops strategies and architectures which support advanced security topics such as Vulnerability Lifecycle Management, Identity Management, Intrusion Detection, Authentication, Authorization and Auditing.
  • Consults with application development and infrastructure development teams to fit systems to architecture, and identify when it is necessary to modify the technical architecture to accommodate customer/stakeholder needs.
  • Responsible for prototyping complex, cross platform business solutions to validate newer technologies.
  • Recommends emerging scalable and reusable technical solutions to increase market share and reduce operational costs.
  • Analyzes the technology industry and market trends to determine potential impact on the business.
  • Influences technology direction and/or adjustments to incorporate into business plans.
  • Influences the selection of hardware and software product standards and the design of standard configurations; makes significant contributions to Product technology roadmaps and architectural principles and frameworks.
  • Develops and manages effective collaborative relationships with other departments, groups, peers, and subordinates (data mgmt., security, and infrastructure).
  • Leads retrospectives and defining opportunities for experiments and POCs.
  • Facilitates cross-team/train learnings, communication and alignment.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors or Masters degree in technical discipline; Masters preferred.
  • 10+ years of architecture experience in applications development in a complex, multi-platform distributed environment.
  • Extensive experience in layered solutions and designs, diverse technical configurations, across multiple technologies and processing environments.
  • In-depth knowledge in software engineering languages and tools; proficient in new and emerging technologies.
  • Extensive knowledge of all product and system components of technical architecture.
  • In-depth understanding of business operations, objectives and strategies including but not limited to, insurance industry, financial services, global business, architecture, technology trends, as well as security minded.
  • Strong leadership skills; coaching and mentoring skills. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills - including negotiation, facilitation, and consensus building skills; ability to influence and persuade, without direct control.
  • High degree of flexibility and ability to work with employees at all levels of the organization with diverse backgrounds.
  • Strong desire to drive change, and ability to adapt to change quickly. Strong consulting skills (relevant/technical); recognized as a thought leader within the company. Ability to balance the long-term "big picture" and short term implications of decisions.

Benefits:

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, its our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace an environment that is free from all discrimination in the workplace, in its business, or by its vendors. Liberty Mutual values diversity and the differences and similarities of our employees. We foster a diverse and inclusive work environment that leads to better ideas, stronger teams and more innovative products and services for our customers. Learn more

Liberty Mutual will consider for employment qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of federal, state, and local laws.

items.title: QA Architect/Cloud - Remote - Full time
items.content:
This is a Full time opportunity with No sponsorship or Visa transfer offered

Candidates must be senior QA Architects with in-depth Cloud experience. This position will be completely remote after a two week, client paid visit to their headquarters in Ft. Lauderdale.

Software (Cloud) Quality Architect

Role Description
Software (Cloud) Quality Architects (SQAs) are individuals who are leaders, experts, and innovators in our software/cloud testing organization. They provide technical leadership and strategic direction to guide continuous improvements to the processes, practices, and tooling used in all areas of software/cloud testing and deployment. These areas include functional testing, unit testing, continuous integration, test automation, operations testing, performance testing, security testing, test case management, and others. SQAs mentor and teach others how to effectively use and apply software testing methodologies, tools and techniques.
Responsibilities
SQAs (cloud) are responsible for:
Participating in discussions on cloud-wide testing strategies with other Architects, Managers, and Directors of Software Engineering.
Providing technical expertise in the development and maintenance of internal tools to support software and cloud testing and test automation.
Establishing and disseminating testing standards and practices that others must adhere to as part of delivering high quality software, infrastructure, platform and operations.
Conducting reviews and providing feedback on the performance of Software Quality Engineers (SQEs) and/or Domain Testers.
Evaluating new or existing software testing tools such as automation frameworks, code coverage analysis tools, test case management systems, and performance, devops, security, and reliability tools.
Assisting teams by conducting testing in property areas such as performance, stability, reliability, usability, and security.
Coaching, training, and mentoring cloud engineers on testing tools, techniques, and methodologies.
Working with cloud engineers and technical leads on unit and integration test direction.
Assisting with the recruitment of candidates for cloud engineering and testing positions.
SQAs are expected to have:
Breadth of understanding and experience in software engineering and software testing with a focus on cloud operations.
Depth of understanding and experience in multiple areas of software testing preferably through the cloud operations lens.
Excellent testing and debugging skills.
Strong problem solving and programming skills.
Good project management and communication skills.

Muthu

- provided by Dice

items.title: Client Advocate
items.content:
Client Advocate at Greene Resources

Remote | International

Job Snapshot

Employee Type: Full-Time

Location: Raleigh, NC

Job Type: Admin – Clerical, Business Development, Customer Service

Experience: Not Specified

Job Description

Job Number: 34042

Job Description:

Our client has a great opportunity for a professional to work remotely from any location as a Client Advocate! The Client Advocate will utilize advanced insurance skills to provide favorable relationships with customers, groups and clients through the prompt, accurate and courteous resolution of benefit and eligibility inquiries. This is a full time, direct hire opportunity!

Responsibilities:

  • Process all incoming enrollment, claims, billing and eligibility questions. This includes but is not limited to emailing/faxing the document to the carrier, entering information into the carrier website, completing carrier spreadsheets or processing the transaction over the phone with the carrier contact.
  • Scrub all applications and identify situations where clarification needs to be made that could have an adverse effect on the eligibility for a participant (missing information) and follow-up with appropriate parties, including escalation if necessary.
  • Responsible for resolving escalated issues such as urgent enrollments, unexpected pharmacy disputes, exception requests, complex claims and billing situations, as well as other unplanned eligibility matters that may come up from time to time. This may require extra communication as well as additional research into group history. Extensive noting of the account may be required.
  • Provide customers with information and advice necessary to make insurance decisions for their families and provide issue resolution on plan options and plan selections.
  • Provide coaching and mentoring for all members of the Client Advocate Center team.
  • Responsibilities also include Client Advocate Center Specialist duties as needed.

Education Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent

Desired Background/Skills:

Qualifications:

  • Minimum three years of customer service experience required in a broker or insurance carrier setting
  • Advanced knowledge of medical insurance and the ability to communicate information to customers
  • MS office experience and computer savvy.
  • Able to navigate through different carrier websites without detailed training
  • Professional phone etiquette and a pleasant tone
  • Must have a positive attitude and excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment without constant supervision and direction
  • Ability to accept both positive feedback and constructive criticism
  • Reliability and punctuality is a must

Greene Resources is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

items.title: Solutions Architect (Remote/Home-based)
items.content:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

The Role

Cloudmark, as part of Proofpoint protects the messaging infrastructure of more than 120 tier-one service providers worldwide, including Orange France, Swisscom, AT&T, Verizon, Comcast, Cox, and NTT. We are expanding our product line to prevent other malicious online activities to make messaging safe.

We are seeking a proactive, creative and knowledgeable Solutions Architect to be the primary technical interface to some of the largest email and mobile Service Providers in Europe, Middle -East and Africa. The role will demand interaction with large scale service providers at the Operations, Network, and Messaging Director level.

The role encompasses a variety of customer-facing technical responsibilities from pre-sales through implementation and customer technical account management. You will be responsible for evangelizing the benefits of our solutions to new customers, advising, designing and implementing Cloudmark e-mail and mobile solutions for new and existing Service Provider customers, and acting as a technical account manager for existing customers. You will support sales account managers and professional service managers by providing pre-sales, professional services, and post-sales technical account management support to new and existing customers. Successful execution of these strategies is required to achieve the region's financial targets and to retain existing customers by ensuring their complete satisfaction.

Travel within Europe, Middle East and Africa is required.

Your day-to-day
  • Pitch, position and demonstrate Cloudmark solutions, presenting the merits of CM solutions over competition
  • Provide pre-sales support such as responding to RFI's/RFP's
  • Design and implement technical solutions to solve customer problems by understanding and documenting key customer requirements and translating them into a detailed design within the confines of the project and product scope
  • Communicate with key customer technical and business representative and ensure technical and business understanding of solutions being implemented
  • Manage technical aspects of integration projects and roll-out of solutions to production
  • Produce deployment solution documentation such detailed design documents, building test harnesses and test plans and preparation of run-books / operations guides
  • Develop and deliver training courses to customers
  • Act as technical account manager for key accounts
  • Identify new opportunities within existing accounts
  • Liaise with other departments (Products, Engineering, Support) around field priorities and ongoing product road-map priorities; act as the internal customer advocate
What you bring to the team
  • Proven experience with Linux system and application administration
  • Previous technical consulting experience desirable - especially implementation experience in carriers and large enterprises
  • Working knowledge of SMTP and / or mobile message protocols
  • Knowledge of Email and / or Mobile Messaging security issues
  • Understanding of Anti-Spam/messaging technologies (not essential but preferred)
  • Experience with data analysis using scripts or other analytical tools (not essential but preferred)
  • Fast and Eager learner - seeks out knowledge rather than waiting for knowledge to be presented
  • Passionate about providing excellent solutions and services to customers
  • Excellent listening skills
  • Excellent presentation skills
  • Willingness to travel within Europe, Middle East and Africa
  • Ability to self-manage time and juggle multiple priorities
  • Ability to work in an organised controlled manner as part of a greater project team or as a single project resource
  • Ability to achieve completion of project deliverable by agreed project deadlines and under pressure
  • Ability to estimate project technical and documentation effort based on a basic understanding of project scope
  • Understanding and experience of working on professional services implementation projects following project life-cycles and standardized implementation methodologies and templates
#LI-SH1

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Travel expenses reimbursed

sample issues include:

Retro Errors: We have not been able to determine why we sometimes have retro pay for STD, Terms, or other types of pay (e.g. Telephone allowance paid to term a year later) and Payroll logging has not yet been successful if finding root causes. While we have this issue, would help to have a Retro Paid Report (vacation, sick, personal , STD, deductions, any other type pay as retro) that shows retro processed by type pay, hours, person (active or term) to identify retros processed in error.
  3. Review Arrears Processing: Review current set up and arrears situations to best practice.
  4. Balance adjustments for Employee/ Employer: Review set up, when/ why can t adjust, impact of retros
  5. Payroll Reports: What are best practice reports to utilize for biweekly payroll processing, validation and auditing (seeded reports plus BI reports)?
  6. Webclock, Time Card and Absence set up: What is best practice set up compared to our set up and configuration, what recommendations to remove any complex/ inefficient configuration or personalization/customization? The root of many payroll issues are: Webclock, Time Cards Absences and Retros, as well as user errors (education).

Sathish M

Sr Resourcing Specialist

Sira Consulting Inc

items.content:
Cloud Architect--Remote

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Digital Health
Company size: 51–200 people
Company: SemanticBits | No office location

Technologies

cloud
amazon-web-services
ansible

Job description

We are looking for a Cloud Architect that can lead the design and development of modern cloud infrastructure on AWS.  You will be the lead of a team of DevSecOps Engineers, setting priorities and direction, mentoring, and designing next generation infrastructure.  You will have a strong focus on automation and CI/CD principles, along with extensive experience and a deep understanding of the offerings within AWS with a strong emphasis on security.  The ideal candidate will be able to design entire application environments that can be fully automated or replicated including network, compute, and data stores. 

SemanticBits is a leading company specializing in the design and development of digital health services, and the work we do is just as unique as the culture we’ve created. We develop cutting-edge solutions to complex problems for commercial, academic, and government organizations. The systems we develop are used in finding cures for deadly diseases, improving the quality of healthcare delivered to millions of people, and revolutionizing the healthcare industry on a nationwide scale. There is a meaningful connection between our work and the real people who benefit from it; and, as such, we create an environment in which new ideas and innovative strategies are encouraged. We are an established company with the mindset of a startup and we feel confident that we offer an employment experience unlike any other and that we set our employees up for professional success every day.

Job Responsibilities

  • Develops tools and processes to enable automated deployment and monitoring of cloud infrastructure and applications.
  • Automates images, systems/network configuration and orchestration using tools such as Cloud Formation, Terraform, Puppet, Ansible, etc.
  • Designs and implements CI/CD pipelines to include application and security testing and allowing for development teams to own the pipeline process from end-to-end.
  • Implements, improves, and augments infrastructure, application and security monitoring tools and overall platform stability.
  • Automating data resiliency and replication based on policies.
  • Responsible for managing and operation of environments.
  • Mentors engineers and peers.
  • Participates in the creation of strategic roadmaps by understanding the needs of the business and mapping technical objectives to those needs.
  • Creates high level reference architecture documentation to meet the technology needs of various stakeholders. 
  • Works autonomously to build customized solutions to meet the business needs.
  • Produces, enhances, and executes the deployment of automated tools to increase efficiencies across the organization.
  • Effectively communicates solutions architecture to management as well as to business stakeholders and the project teams.
  • Improves deployment and release management process.

Experience and Expertise

  • Significant experience designing, deploying, and supporting production cloud environments, particularly multi-region/multi-AZ environments.
  • Continuous monitoring and logging of all applications layers and all infrastructure (e.g. New Relic, Splunk, CloudWatch)
  • Continuous alerting and notification based on monitors and logs (e.g. PagerDuty)
  • Hands-on experience with container technologies including Docker
  • Hands-on experience with Kubernetes a plus, knowledge of Kubernetes required
  • Self-healing clusters using robust health-check services and cloud load balancers (e.g. ELB/ALB/ELB, ECS)
  • Horizontally scalable compute including autoscaling rules
  • Horizontally scalable databases including read replicas
  • Automated build, test, and deployment through modern CI/CD
  • Infrastructure-as-code via Terraform and CloudFormation
  • Configuration-as-code via Ansible
  • Security at rest and in transit via encryption
  • Security automation using tools like OWASP-ZAP
  • Advanced networking concepts and implementation in AWS

Benefits:

  • Generous base salary
  • Three weeks of PTO
  • Excellent health benefits program (Medical, dental and vision)
  • Education and conference reimbursement
  • 401k retirement plan. We contribute 3% of base salary irrespective of employee's contribution
  • 100% paid short-term and long-term disability
  • 100% paid life insurance
  • FSA
  • Casual working environment
  • Flexible office hours
  • New laptop (Mac or PC - your choice)

SemanticBits, LLC is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are also a veteran-friendly employer.

Apply now

About SemanticBits

SemanticBits is a leading company specializing in the design and development of digital health services, and the work we do is just as unique as the culture we’ve created. We develop cutting-edge solutions to complex problems for commercial, academic, and government organizations. The systems we develop are used in finding cures for deadly diseases, improving the quality of healthcare delivered to millions of people, and revolutionizing the healthcare industry on a nationwide scale. There is a meaningful connection between our work and the real people who benefit from it; and, as such, we create an environment in which new ideas and innovative strategies are encouraged. We are an established company with the mindset of a startup and we feel confident that we offer an employment experience unlike any other and that we set our employees up for professional success every day.

Salary & Benefits

  • Generous base salary
  • Three weeks of PTO
  • Excellent health benefits program (Medical, dental and vision)
  • Education and conference reimbursement
  • 401k retirement plan. We contribute 3% of base salary irrespective of employee's contribution
  • 100% paid short-term and long-term disability
  • 100% paid life insurance
  • FSA
  • Casual Working Environment
  • Flexible Office Hours

SemanticBits, LLC is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are also a veteran-friendly employer.

Benefits

  • Medical, dental, vision, life, disability
  • Matched 401K plan
  • Generous vacation allowances, floating holidays, and sick leave
  • Continued Education Reimbursement
  • Free coffee and snacks

items.content:
Senior Technical Solution Architect

We are looking for a talented and motivated person who will join our enterprise solutions department here at RebelMouse. We love people who bring value beyond just code and technology, who cares about ideas and concepts and want their voice and expression to be heard. We are a small team so you won’t be just a cog in the machine. We want you to love scalable solutions, and actively be part of the creative process of making the company more scalable.
RebelMouse is a 100% distributed team. Our team works from 20+ countries and have very flexible schedules.
Diversity matters a lot to us. Our founder and CEO is transgender nd we are a safe, positive, supportive environment for everyone to be themselves. We proudly are fully distributed with no office. Anyone from anywhere in the world can rise to the highest levels in our company. 

What you need to know:

  • Being able to work directly with clients as a project leader for building solutions in complex environments

  • Manages to completion multifunctional projects 
  • Develops and maintains effective relationships with clients as a key member in solutions and strategy decisions
  • Designs and delivers multiple enterprise-wide system solutions to the external client
  • Identifies and develops new opportunities at existing clients as well as opportunities with new clients
  • Good understanding of interment media market
  • Excellent understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3
  • Good understanding of vanilla JavaScript
  • Experience with responsive and adaptive design
  • Proficiency in ads setup
  • Experienced in Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP)
  • Good understanding of browser rendering behavior and performance
  • Understanding of a site performance optimizations and technics 
  • Strong SEO optimization experience

tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
As an endeavor of Liberty Mutual, Workgrid Software is changing the way enterprise software is built. Our mission is to create beautiful purpose-built software that focuses on improving the employee experience.

At Workgrid, we believe employees should be productive, not busy. The amount of systems in today's business environment is overwhelming the workforce. Employees are overloaded with information, spending hours checking and managing their work, finding information, and taking action on menial tasks. This is causing significant communication and productivity issues in the workplace.

Workgrid focuses on creating solutions that solve the most common and inefficient workplace technology challenges faced by mid-large global businesses. Everything we do is because we believe people have a purpose. We create intuitive experiences that enable human potential by building software that people love.

Workgrid is actively seeking a Solutions Architect who will be responsible for developing a strong technical understanding of the Workgrid platform and leading the solution approach for onboarding external customers. Workgrid is on an AWS platform, node Back End, serverless, multi-tenant, and global. Standards of SAML and OIDC are used. Microapps use web technologies such as HTML and JavaScript with a node Back End. You will be the technical lead working with the customers technical lead to set up, deploy, provision, and connect the customers systems (modern SaaS to Legacy) using web services such as REST and SOAP to create a meaningful and engaging employee experience.

You will also be responsible for establishing reusable patterns whenever possible and providing thought-leadership to the Product team, as well as product recommendations that enable the customers. Develop specifications for new features. Hands-on approach but may also mentor and guide other team members on the execution of the strategy. Identify and fill gaps to enable the customer to be self-sufficient on the platform. This could be through additional documentation or recommendations to the Product team on the core platform.

The actual internal level/grade for this role will depend on the candidates overall experience and skill level. Ability to Work Remote anywhere in the Continental United States.

About the role:

  • Technical Lead Architect who will develop the solution approach for onboarding new customers to the Workgrid platform.
  • Provide technical mentorship to the customer to teach them how to use the product and become self-sufficient.
  • Provides oversight on the execution of the architectural approach to onboarding customers. Influence and ensure solutions follow leading guidelines, are scalable, and whenever possible re-usable for other customers.
  • Designs and develops IT architecture (deployment, provisioning users, connectors) scalable solutions to business problems in alignment with the Workgrid architecture direction and standards.
  • Provides consultation and collaborates with Head of Product, CEO, and Head of Customer Success regarding long and short-range product features.
  • Recommends and drives innovative solutions, which anticipates the future direction of the business, its drivers and technology strategy.
  • Provides consultation on leveraging new and existing software and technology.
  • Leads teams, may have overall leadership responsibility for product architecture and design.
  • Reviews and ensures major architectural designs are consistent, maintainable, flexible and cost effective solutions.
  • Works with or leads technical teams to identify functional requirements that drive architecture and technology to meet customer needs and enables business capability.
  • Participates with application and infrastructure design architects to provide guidance for development and releases.
  • Develops strategies and architectures which support advanced security topics such as Vulnerability Lifecycle Management, Identity Management, Intrusion Detection, Authentication, Authorization and Auditing.
  • Consults with application development and infrastructure development teams to fit systems to architecture, and identify when it is necessary to modify the technical architecture to accommodate customer/stakeholder needs.
  • Responsible for prototyping complex, cross platform business solutions to validate newer technologies.
  • Recommends emerging scalable and reusable technical solutions to increase market share and reduce operational costs.
  • Analyzes the technology industry and market trends to determine potential impact on the business.
  • Influences technology direction and/or adjustments to incorporate into business plans.
  • Influences the selection of hardware and software product standards and the design of standard configurations; makes significant contributions to Product technology roadmaps and architectural principles and frameworks.
  • Develops and manages effective collaborative relationships with other departments, groups, peers, and subordinates (data mgmt., security, and infrastructure).
  • Leads retrospectives and defining opportunities for experiments and POCs.
  • Facilitates cross-team/train learnings, communication and alignment.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors or Masters degree in technical discipline; Masters preferred.
  • 10+ years of architecture experience in applications development in a complex, multi-platform distributed environment.
  • Extensive experience in layered solutions and designs, diverse technical configurations, across multiple technologies and processing environments.
  • In-depth knowledge in software engineering languages and tools; proficient in new and emerging technologies.
  • Extensive knowledge of all product and system components of technical architecture.
  • In-depth understanding of business operations, objectives and strategies including but not limited to, insurance industry, financial services, global business, architecture, technology trends, as well as security minded.
  • Strong leadership skills; coaching and mentoring skills. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills - including negotiation, facilitation, and consensus building skills; ability to influence and persuade, without direct control.
  • High degree of flexibility and ability to work with employees at all levels of the organization with diverse backgrounds.
  • Strong desire to drive change, and ability to adapt to change quickly. Strong consulting skills (relevant/technical); recognized as a thought leader within the company. Ability to balance the long-term "big picture" and short term implications of decisions.

Benefits:

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, its our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace an environment that is free from all discrimination in the workplace, in its business, or by its vendors. Liberty Mutual values diversity and the differences and similarities of our employees. We foster a diverse and inclusive work environment that leads to better ideas, stronger teams and more innovative products and services for our customers. Learn more

Liberty Mutual will consider for employment qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of federal, state, and local laws.
