items.title: Sales Solution Manager - Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Position: Solution Sales Manager - SalesSchedule: Full-Time / RemoteReports To: Director of Sales OperationsSalary: Base Pay + Commission Overview: Nomad Global Communications Solutions is a leading provider of communication and response products serving a wide variety of customers. Our purpose is to be the solution when every second matters. We seek a candidate that is self-inspired to learn and demonstrates a high degree of customer service while positively contributing to our team. The Solution Sales Manager position is a hybrid role combining elements of sales, business development, account management, customer service and research into a single position. Successful candidates will be highly motivated, self-directed, eager to learn, and comfortable with some ambiguity while determining what it takes to successfully grow a line-of-business. The SSM reports to and works closely with the Director of Sales and the entire sales team. The position also requires successful cross-functional interaction with many groups for sales execution including: Project Management, Engineering, Procurement, Operations, and Finance. Please do not apply for this position if you do not meet the minimum qualifications for this job as sales/business development is not transactional sales and customer service. If all your experience is in transactional sales and you can't articulate and show proof of business/relationship development success, please don't apply. If you want a list of existing clients to call on, we're not for you. We like people who are not afraid to ask questions. If you are self-directed and motivated, you may be a good match. If you are not at least a mildly avid reader, you'll probably struggle in this role. We delete boring résumés and cover letters at the first opportunity, so take a few minutes, stand out and let us know why you are the critical component missing from our team. We believe strongly in metrics and measurement, so if you are used to coasting in your role and hiding in the shadows, you won't like it here. But if you thrive in an independent environment, are adept at relationship building and love to lead, we want to know who you are. We have a sincere appreciation for out of the box thinking, humor and creativity, so make us laugh, send your résumé via a singing telegram or do something different to stand out from the multitudes of résumés that we receive. If you are not on LinkedIn, you've got a tough hill to climb with us, but in the same vein, if you have 2000+ contacts, we wonder if you spend way too much time on LinkedIn. However, if you are excited about an opportunity to grow a product line with huge potential, backed by one of the most respected names in the industry, you just might like it here. You will have to travel, interface with a wide variety of people and quickly get up to speed, but the right person will thrive in this role. But know that we won't settle for just anybody. We've got a great team in place and we're not willing to mess that up. If you have your wits about you and understand sales/business development, you'll be able to sift through this information and realize the key components that we are looking to hire. Be sure to let us know in your cover letter what the last book you read was and why you chose it. This position has plenty of room for growth, and won't keep you behind a desk all week. In fact, if you find yourself behind a desk all week, you're likely to get fired. We believe that relationships matter and hope you do too as that is at the core of our business model. So if this all sounds good, we'd love to meet you. But please, don't just send us the boring old cover letter and résumé that you just sent to 100 other companies. Essential Functions / Responsibilities: Drive growth through new business generation. This position will likely focus on the Law Enforcement/Emergency Management markets.Perform ongoing research with a focus on utilizing various lead generation services and tactics to generate sales (meetings, Google Alerts, blogs, etc.).Interpret and share customer insights with Marketing and other departments.Provide market feedback to leadership regarding competitive offerings as well as generate their own new business.Perform ongoing research with a focus on identifying contacts, sales leads, and identify the top 100 LE/EM customers and achieve a minimum conversion rate.Work to understand everything you can about mobile connectivity and related technologies while identifying other markets that are underserved by Nomad.Respond promptly to inbound sales and product inquiries generated by phone, website traffic, lead generation services, etc.Attend trade shows and other industry events to represent Nomad, generate leads, and to reinforce/enhance the company's reputation. Travel required.Become a trusted advisor with customers by learning their businesses, challenges, and risks.Build and manage a pipeline of sales opportunities needed to achieve monthly/annual revenue objectives.Learn and understand the Nomad sales methods, processes and procedures to provide frictionless customer experience.Prepare quarterly reports on the status, plans, challenges, next steps, and key growth opportunities within your business focus. Qualifications & Experience: Excellent organizational, communication, telephone and interpersonal skills.Professional verbal and written communication style.Must have a high level of emotional intelligence to include: demonstrating empathy, benefitting from criticism, keeping commitments, being quick to apologize, and taking the time to pause.Self-starter comfortable with figuring things out as you go and comfortable with ambiguity, but confident to lead.Exceptional work habits with the ability to work independently and successfully in a team environment.High energy team player with a "can do" attitude and bias towards action.Proficient using standard business software including ERP, CRM, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and some Adobe CS products.

by Jobble

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)

items.content:
Sr. Solutions Engineer (100% Remote) - MyTime (Series B) - B2B SaaS Startup

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: blockchain, functional programming, Recruiting
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Source Coders Inc | No office location

Technologies

saas
ruby
ruby-on-rails
data-migration
sql

Job description

Job Description

You will lead the effort to design and develop data migration tools and processes that enable new customers to go live with MyTime's Point of Sale / Appointment Scheduling / CRM solution. New customers cannot go live on our platform until you’ve completed your work, so this role is vital to the growth of the company.  

You’ll work with the SAAS implementation manager to understand the customer's needs and integration points. You’ll need to be creative and detail oriented as you develop custom approaches to extract, convert and migrate data such as clients, appointments and transactions from legacy systems into MyTime.  You'll need to determine when MyTime will be the master and when we will be a client of another system with real-time or asynchronous connections. In some cases, you'll also lead or assist with software development of custom features for the client that are 'must haves' before they can go live.

As a software engineer, you should be generally passionate about coding and have an interest in building applications with high usability, scalability, and test coverage. In your everyday work, you should continuously contribute to good overall software design with the goal to achieve a highly structured large scale software product. You should also maintain a high awareness of development industry trends and best practices.

In addition to your passion for coding, you should also want to help in other aspects of building a new company: Designing features, making good product decisions, and building a culture of excellence. We’re seeking engineers who are ready to attack deep technical challenges as well as have an impactful role in product and company development!
 

Key Responsibilities

  • Execute specific data migration tasks utilizing both manual and scripted processes

  • Develop and maintain web scrapers that can accurately pick up data elements and import them into the right database fields

  • Investigate legacy software products to figure out the best approach for data extraction

  • Implement a migration pipeline between two enterprise systems, likely using a data integration platform and in some cases a continuous syncing solution

  • Create individual data migration jobs to move portions data based on the needs of different customers go-live date

  • Write field-level transformation and validation code to allow data to flow reliably

  • Be responsible for verifying the pipeline is acting predictably: validate at each stage of migration, and generate reconciliation reports

Qualifications

  • Minimum 2 years of software implementation or technical solutions experience; knowledge of Ruby on Rails and AngularJS, a plus

  • Intermediate to expert proficiency with analysis and migration of SQL databases

  • Experience pipelining data in an imperfect environment—retrying through rate limits, http errors, network issues, etc.

  • Experience with agile software development environments

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, fluent in English

About MyTime

MyTime is a fully integrated scheduling, payments and automated marketing platform, specializing in large multi-location chains and franchises. Our mission critical software -- which includes in-store scheduling and online booking, client record management, email and SMS marketing, and a full point of sale for handling payments -- is used in every aspect of the customer journey. Our customers rely on their service businesses to remain competitive in the age of Amazon, and they need a next generation POS to help them achieve this growth. We aspire to be the “operating system” of their business.

We also made it easy to plug our online booking, payments and messaging capabilities into the places customers are found today, including Google Search, Facebook, Instagram, and the merchants’ own websites and mobile apps. Upon adopting MyTime, our customers see average revenue growth of up to 30% through improved operational efficiency, greater customer retention, and access to new customer acquisition channels.

Our product is used at over 14,000 locations across the globe, ranging from single-location sole proprietors to multi-billion dollar Fortune 500 chains.  As a completely cloud-based solution, MyTime is designed for quick and easy deployments. It’s lauded for its ease-of-use and short ramp-up time, having won numerous awards such as the Best Commerce Product of 2017 from the Local Search Association.

MyTime is backed by Upfront Ventures and Khosla Ventures and was founded by Ethan Anderson, a successful serial entrepreneur whose first startup, Redbeacon, won TechCrunch50 in 2009 and was acquired by The Home Depot.

Apply now

About Source Coders Inc

Based in California and London, UK, we are a team of passionate professionals with over two decades of experience in the recruiting industry. We specialize in hiring for the fin-tech and emerging tech industries; matching innovative engineers and tech executives to companies who share the same goals and ambitions.

We combine advanced tools and human insight to create a matching service like no other. Our full-stack approach to recruiting means we deliver a personalized, end-to-end experience for employers and candidates.

Benefits

  • casual dress
  • private medical
  • uncapped commision
  • unlimited PTO
  • occasional work from home

items.title: Solutions Architect (DBaaS)- (Remote/Telecommute)
items.content:
Job Description

VetsEZ (Veterans EZ Info Inc.) is a leading provider of information technology services to government and commercial markets. We are a prime contractor on T4NG (VA), VECTOR (VA), CIO-SP3 (NIH) and VETS2 GWAC (GSA) contract vehicles. VetsEZ is an ISO 9001, ISO 27001 and ISO 20000-1 certified company and has been independently appraised at CMMI-DEV Level 3 by the CMMI Institute.

VetsEZ is also a verified Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) in VA's Vendor Information Pages (VIP) and State of California's Disabled Veteran Business Enterprise (DVBE) program.

VetsEZ strongly believes in providing tangible solutions that improve day-to-day business transactions, maximize efficiencies, eliminate risks and reduce costs for our clients. Subject Matter Experts from VetsEZ provide thought leadership and innovative approaches to federal agencies to shape the future of Healthcare IT. For more information, visit us at www.vetsez.com.

We are seeking a Database-As-A-Service (DBaaS) Solutions Architect for a 100% remote position, who is a motivated cloud database and storage expert to take responsibility for ensuring continuous operations and business continuity for all production and non-production Database-as-a-Service (DBaaS) instances supported in an enterprise cloud environment (AWS). Our DBaaS capability is designed to provide our customers with database services that are fully automated, designed for scale, and highly resilient to faults and performance-degrading events.

The ideal candidate will be a bring a rich knowledge of database administration (DBA) best practices and design patterns, along with a strong software engineering background, and is experienced with high volume, always-on, mission-critical production applications. Typical workloads include MongoDB, CockroachDB, Redis, ElasticSearch, Kafka, and PostgreSQL. As a key member of the Cloud DBaaS Engineering Team, you will be responsible for the performance, service availability, data reliability, and business continuity for dozens of the databases supporting our large-scale microservices-based cloud platform.

The ideal candidate has strong data systems, data storage, and development experience, and has worked with modern open source NewSQL and NoSQL platforms, cloud deployment models and test-driven development in a fast-paced agile environment.

Required Qualifications:

  • Expert Administration of Mongo Databases throughout the development and production lifecycles in an AWS environment.
  • Be a subject matter expert on database technologies, review change proposals, and contribute to security & operations procedures
  • Setup and maintenance of replication, backup and recover, RDS
  • Design and develop logical and physical database designs from customer requirements
  • Review and improve backup, replication and restoration strategy
  • Utilize cloud databases where necessary
  • Propose and implement database monitoring solutions to display system health and proactively alert possible issues
  • Define SLA agreements with our DevOps team and other customers of the cloud platform
  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent engineering discipline
  • 3+ years of software development experience
  • 5+ years of experience in software engineering or IT organizations
  • 2+ years direct experience with databases, Linux and cloud deployments

Preferred Skills:

  • Automation of tasks through Ansible
  • Work with DevOps and other teams to troubleshoot data-related problems, find root-causes, implement solutions, and contribute to incident reports
  • Production experience in large-scale NoSQL data infrastructures such as Cassandra, MongoDB, etc.
  • Application experience with SQL databases such as PostgreSQL, Cockroach DB, MySQL, Amazon RDS, etc.
  • Familiarity with cloud infrastructure platforms (AWS preferred) and container orchestration technologies (e.g., Kubernetes and Docker)

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status

items.content:
SOFTWARE SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT

As a Solutions Architect, you will work as an advisor across multiple delivery teams, providing innovative solutions. You will coordinate with stakeholders, architects, and development leaders to define the most effective solution to business problems while leveraging our team?s knowledge of existing systems, services, and capabilities.
Your deep hands-on knowledge of design, development, coding, and testing across various technology domains will be counted on to set strategic direction and solve complex and mission-critical problems.

SOFTWARE SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT?ROLE RESPONSIBILITY
  • Analyze and prepare recommendations to address existing and potential trouble areas in systems and procedures across the organization
  • Participate in the priority and assign of work within technical teams and ensure compliance with architecture and design definitions
  • Participate in code reviews, collaborating with development leads to enforce strict guidelines around code quality, code coverage, and concurrent development of concurrent releases
  • Recommend and lead re-design or re-development of sub-systems that do not fit the architecture design
  • Develop strong partnership with business, product and engineering leaders to define business, product and technology architecture
  • Review solution designs to determine their technical viability and their relevance to the business goals
  • Participate in internal projects that help scale the group, implement best practices, improve our processes and methodologies, and ensure the high quality of our technical solutions
  • Lead and participate in production support when critical system issues arise
  • Advocate and enforce the adoption of automated deployments and efficient CI/CD processes
SOFTWARE SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
  • BS/MS/PhD in computer science/related field
  • 10+ years experience as a software engineer / solution architect
  • 5+ years experience in SaaS and/or distributed systems architecture
SOFTWARE SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
  • Experience in software development leveraging a variety of languages such as Java, Python, .NET, NodeJS, etc.
  • Experience with Java/J2EE, Web Services, Spring Framework, and Messaging
  • Experience providing architectural guidance and oversight to development teams
  • Hands on experience with Java, Spring Boot, Maven/Gradle, Git, Jenkins, Nexus, and SonarQube
  • Understands the concepts of Cloud, Continuous Delivery, TDD, and automated testing frameworks ? Selenium, REST Client, Soap UI, REST Assured
  • Experience with both relational database like DB2, Oracle, MySQL, Sql Server, and NoSQL databases such as MongoDB and DynamoDB
  • Experience with JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Redux, or NodeJS and corresponding unit testing frameworks
  • Experience designing and deploying workloads to Amazon Web Services or similar cloud platform
  • Hands-on experience with developing, architecting and implementing REST APIs and micro services?
  • Deep understanding of financial services with experience in payment systems (preferred)
SOFTWARE SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCIES?
Drives to Win?- Possesses sustained energy to set and meet challenging objectives; the ability to organize resources to achieve a standard of excellence in outcomes and monitor on-going performance
Communicates Clearly and Effectively?- The ability to effectively share ideas, thoughts, information and feelings with a diverse range of audiences to development two-way understanding; it includes speaking, listening and written communication skills; the ability to influence others towards a desired way of thinking or course of action and to secure agreement to achieve common goals through effective negotiation
Demonstrates Flexibility and Adaptability?- Is open and receptive to appropriate change; the ability to manage and shift priorities as required, and to incorporate new approaches in support of changing organizational needs; possesses confidence in challenging the status quo and providing input to change efforts
Focuses on Customer Service?-A desire to help or meet the needs of customers; the ability to respond to the changing needs of the customer while maintaining a high standard of quality and adhering to company policies, standards, practices and processes
Teamwork?- Is able to establish and maintain a good rapport and cooperative relationships with customer and co-workers; able to work cooperatively across organizational boundaries to achieve shared goals; possesses an understanding of team dynamics and provides tangible contributions to teams, fostering collaboration and an environment of mutual trust and respect
Builds Relationships?- The ability to identify, build and maintain formal and informal networks and productive relationships with both internal and external stakeholder; it includes leveraging these contacts to influence positive outcomes for the business
Develops Self?- Maintains a commitment to personal and professional development, keeping abreast of current professional knowledge; is personally committed to and actively works to continuously improve self
Solves Problems?- Uses rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions; able to think critically; to recognize and anticipate a problem (technical, operational, process, organizational) and to identify and implement the best solution in a timely manner
Manages and Executes? on? Projects?- Establishes plans and manages resources to ensure work is completed efficiently, on time and on budget

items.content:
Kensium is currently seeking a Solution Architect to join our Magento Delivery Practice. You will have the exciting opportunity to drive insights and innovation for our client's public facing web properties. You'll play an integral role in an exciting and fast-paced team where the sky is truly the limit. In this role you will play a crucial part in understanding complex customer environments, developing solutions, and identifying new ways for brands to engage with their customers across digital channels on the Magento platform. We're looking for a candidate to sit in our Chicago office, right by the Sears Tower, but will consider remote work for the right individual. You should be a self-aware, self-starting individual with a well-rounded skillset; someone who has the depth and breadth of technical knowledge to know the "right way" to develop automated processes and operation systems, while also possessing the fearlessness to propose new and innovative ideas. The right person for this job will pride themselves on taking responsibility for their role, but also not become too distracted by titles, because we often wear many hats. You should have the capacity to be given a task and own it because we loathe micro-management, and you should as well. You should be a technologist who is passionate about their work and strives for continuous improvement. This role carries with it the possibility of providing a good deal of influence on how our growing team matures as we expand our influence within the global e-commerce eco-system. A successful candidate will be technically savvy, and business proficient; thriving on ensuring our clients are successful. THIS MIGHT BE THE JOB FOR YOU IF YOU: Are currently a Solution Architect, or full-stack developer with a handful of projects under your belt, as a developer, or solution architect. Have experience running production systems. Have experience designing software delivery pipelines from development to production. Have leveraged automation, metrics, and logging to improve products and processes. Have an intellectual curiosity to pursue the unknown and to continuously improve. Role and Responsibility Own the technical solution and outcome of a project from beginning to end. Consult with clients and lead them to the optimal technical solutions based on their needs, and business. Follow and passionately promote quality best practices from all sides of software engineering and systems operations. Design, implement and maintain solutions that contribute to the automation of code/infrastructure changes, empowering development teams to have a seamless framework to deliver the best software. Maintain, enhance, and ensure good health of all software delivery processes and systems. Actively participate in high-level team activities such as architecture or process improvements. Can analyze data to learn how to improve processes and systems continuously. Participation in pre & post-sales technical scoping, requirements gathering, and solution creation & review. Preferred Qualifications and Education Requirements PHP/Magento web development experience (M1 & M2) Real-world e-commerce experience with Magento development (Plugin / Theme development / API) in the last 3 years Prior work experience in a Consulting/Architecture position within a software and/or services company Bachelor's Degree in either Informatics, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Interactive Design, Instructional Systems, or related field. Familiarity with Project Management Software (Wrike, Jira, DoneDone, SmartSheets) Experience of Zend Framework, Symfony, Core PHP, PHP frameworks Firm grasp of Git-based source control Competent with PHP object-oriented programming & MVC applications Competent with MySQL-based database concepts Profound knowledge of web technologies (HTML/XML/PHP/JavaScript) Lead the QA team to insure they successfully deliver results in a timely and useful manner Create the testing strategy for the QA team Define test plans for projects and the team Build test scripts and manage the team to properly execute them. Writes test plans based on requirements Bachelor's degree or work experience equivalent 3+ Years of experience in QA and testing 2+ Years leading QA teams Knowledge of testing software applications developed using technologies such as Selenium, Postman, SoapUI and JMeter Experience in the Ecommerce domain as well as ERP Deep knowledge of the core hard skills in the areas of Quality Assurance and Testing Lifecycle EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

by Jobble

items.content:
The Microsoft Solutions Architect/Developer plays a leadership role in the digital transformation of the organization. Working with the business unit leaders and department heads, the Microsoft Solutions Architect/Developer determines, evaluates, guides, designs, develops and implements information technology solutions that enhance business value and achieve business objectives. Utilizing tools including but not limited to Microsoft SharePoint, Office 365, Microsoft Flow, and Power Apps the Microsoft Solutions Architect/Developer leads projects from inception through design and delivery to successful implementation.


PRIMARY ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Research, Design, Develop, and Review solutions built on Office 365, SharePoint Online, Teams, PowerApps, Flow, and other Microsoft Cloud offerings
  • Work closely with Architects and PMs to build scalable, extensible, and secure applications
  • Ensure technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
  • Creation of technical design documentation
  • Define best practices while working with cross functional teams to ensure their adoption
  • Lead a team of dynamic, energetic software engineers
  • Provide team mentoring, coding, testing, and on-time delivery of high-quality work
  • Gather business unit and department requirements, determine priorities, perform due diligence activities, select and recommend solutions, assist with development of scopes of work and implementation plans
  • Develop and prioritize solutions that enhance business value, produce a return on investment and achieve business objectives
  • Administer, manage and implement changes to enterprise Office 365 and SharePoint environments
  • Development and implementation of solutions for enterprise content Management, workflows and enterprise search
  • Maintain excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office 365, Microsoft Azure services
  • Identify, research and keep apprised of emerging cloud technologies, solutions, strategies,
    and developments documenting with the goal of identifying opportunities for their use
  • Provide thought leadership on best practices for solution design with an understanding of
    Information Architecture functionality including site mapping, application integration,
    enterprise search, content classification as well as mobile platforms
  • Assist in the development of training documentation, and provide training as needed

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE



  • Bachelors degree in Business, Computer Science or other related fields
  • Microsoft Solutions Expert or Developer certification
  • 7 to 10 years of software development experience with 3+ years of consulting experience
    within a specific Microsoft Solution platform/technology on multiple projects at enterprise
    level clients
  • Strong experience in PowerApps and Microsoft Flow
  • Strong experience implementing and managing Microsoft SharePoint with an understanding
    of overall architecture, hierarchy, and administration
  • Strong experience with the SharePoint Framework including web parts and extensions
  • Strong experience in integrating SharePoint with third party enterprise tools
  • Strong experience working with SharePoint APIs including REST and CSOM
  • Strong experience in Team Collaboration, Content management, Web portals, Enterprise
    search, and User management
  • Technical proficiency in developing SharePoint based solutions using web parts, master
    pages, page layouts, content types, workflows, PowerShell and. NET technologies including
    CSOM, C#, ASP. NET, JavaScript, jQuery and REST API
  • Skilled with PowerShell for O365 and SharePoint and the O365 administration portal.
  • Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio and Git or other version control systems
  • Experience working with related technologies such as SQL Server including SSRS and SSIS,
    Internet Information Server, Active Directory, Microsoft Azure Services
  • Experience or familiarity with commonly used open source or third-party SharePoint
    administration and application tools, such as those from AvePoint, K2, Nintex & Sharegate
  • Experience with large migrations from SharePoint On-Premises to SharePoint Online (Office
    365)
  • Knowledge of Agile, Scrum methodology
  • Professional commitment, detail oriented, high focus on quality, passion for learning new
    skills
  • Ability to adapt to time critical deadlines and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent organizational, interpersonal, presentation, oral and written communication skills
  • Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively in a geographically disperse
    working environment
  • Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical personnel
  • Advanced troubleshooting skills and ability to solve complex issues effectively
  • Develop and deploy solutions independently and as a team member (DevOps)


- provided by Dice

items.title: Solution Architect (Telecom / BSS / OSS) - Telecommuting/Remote
items.content:
Telecommuting/remote position

Position Summary:

The Solution Architect position exists to manage, gather, and process information related to CHR Business Support Systems (BSS) and Operational Support Systems (OSS) so that CHR products integrate with devices on the client service delivery network. This position ensures Client satisfaction in the initial solution design, provides client guidance, captures technical requirements, and obtains Client acceptance of the technical solution. Incumbent will successfully meet or exceed business unit goals while maintaining quality standards, controlling expenses, and following company and business unit directives and practices.

Primary Accountabilities:

  • Lead the Technical aspect of developing Client specific, tactical and strategic component architecture of B/OSS systems and technologies, including all CHR product offerings and integrated systems, ensuring that designs, architectures, and solutions satisfy all product, project and business requirements
  • Communicate the architectural vision to the Client and the activations and development teams
  • Assist in the planning and design of new or upgraded systems (conversion)
  • Identify, assess and document advising stakeholders on options and risks
  • Assist Sales Organization in Statement of Work research and preparation
  • Identify and document what the B/OSS systems, process or product/service must do in order to fulfill the business, functional and non-functional requirements
  • Lead in the evolution of product and system roadmaps tactical and strategic component architecture designs will be in compliance with company direction
  • Identify and assist the team in communicating action items that result from the information gathering throughout the CHR Solutions organization, including Product Management
  • Manage pre-and post-release expectations
  • Conduct research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business unit, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible
  • Ability to travel up to 50% by car and/or plane, may include weekend travel; ability to travel internationally is required for some positions. Current passport and valid driver s license required.

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Semaphore CI

Ci/cd Solutions Engineer


EU-only
As a Solutions Engineer, you will apply your DevOps and CI/CD expertise to be the creative force behind successful onboarding of new [Semaphore](https://semaphoreci.com) customers.

You'll love this job if you're a software delivery specialist with experience automating infrastructure and deployments from scratch all the way to production. Working at a CI/CD product company will expose you to use cases of cutting-edge companies and take your career to the next level.

This is a remote position available both part-time (20 hours/week) and full-time.



# Responsibilities
* Respond to pre- and post-sales technical questions by providing expert guidance on CI/CD, with strong skill sets in cloud operations, development technologies and processes.
* Act as a technical solutions provider in customer-facing video calls.
* Create and verify CI/CD projects in a wide range of technology stacks (languages, frameworks, containers, configuration mgmt tools, cloud providers), that form the basis of Semaphore documentation and other technical content.
* Establish and maintain a deep understanding of the overall Semaphore product offer and the competitive landscape.

# Requirements
An ideal candidate has 5+ years of hands-on experience in DevOps tools, including but not limited to:

* Jenkins / Gitlab CI / CircleCI
* AWS / Google Cloud
* Linux
* Docker
* A programming language
* Bash scripting
* Chef / Puppet / Ansible

You'll join an international distributed team so superb written and verbal communication in English is a must.

**Working at Semaphore**

* The impact of working on a product that's competing on a global market.
* Join a small team of around 20 full-time people who love what they do.
* A healthy 40-hour work week, friendly and supportive work environment.
* Competitive salary.
* Company retreats.
* Space to learn continuously and choose the tools and equipment for your job
* Paid trips to conferences and books of your choice.
* Interact with developers that use Semaphore and talk about the latest and greatest way to develop and ship software.
* Paid membership at a fitness club of your choice

Semaphore is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with our mission of serving a diverse and global audience, we value a diverse workforce and inclusive culture which reflects that. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, disability, and veteran status.

#Location
- EU-only

items.content:
My Team and I over at Nigel Frank International are working with a Microsoft Gold-Certified Consultancy to fill an Azure Application Architect position. This firm has recently been experiencing a large amount of growth in their application development projects, and want to move quickly to find highly skilled Architects to keep up with the demand.

This is a permanent, client-facing role that will require a solid 50-50% split of hands-on development work and leadership responsibilities. This role is best suited for candidates who want to assume a leadership position while still working directly on the tech side of things.

Skills / Requirements:
-15+ years of experience working in development / architecture.
-At least the last 3 years working with Azure.
-PaaS focused background.
-Your most recent position must have been an Architecture role at a Consultancy.
-Proficiency with the following: C#, Docker, Kubernetes, Python, Angular, JavaScript, .NET.
-Adept understanding of DevOps and Agile processes.

Responsibilities:
-Minimum 40-50% hands-on development, the other 50% of the time you will be taking on leadership responsibilities and POW.
-Responsible for design, analysis and planning of application architecture in Azure.

Candidates must be located in Dallas, TX. You will have the opportunity to work 100% remote from Dallas, with a light element of travel.

*Please note: this is a permanent role. All candidates must be either US Citizens or Green Card holders. Visa sponsorship is not provided.

This is a highly competitive, brand new job on the market. In order to fast-track your opportunity to secure an interview, please send your resume to Jordan at: [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] .

Jordan Hopf
Azure DevOps
Nigel Frank International
Email: [Click Here to Email Your Resum?]
Phone: (972)- (ext 7266)

items.title: Sr. Solutions Engineer (100% Remote) - MyTime (Series B) - B2B SaaS Startup at Source Coders
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=9, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=12, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Sr. Solutions Engineer (100% Remote) - MyTime (Series B) - B2B SaaS Startup

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: blockchain, functional programming, Recruiting
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Source Coders | No office location

Technologies

saas
ruby
python
data-migration
sql

Job description

Job Description

You will lead the effort to design and develop data migration tools and processes that enable new customers to go live with MyTime's Point of Sale / Appointment Scheduling / CRM solution. New customers cannot go live on our platform until you’ve completed your work, so this role is vital to the growth of the company.  

You’ll work with the SAAS implementation manager to understand the customer's needs and integration points. You’ll need to be creative and detail oriented as you develop custom approaches to extract, convert and migrate data such as clients, appointments and transactions from legacy systems into MyTime.  You'll need to determine when MyTime will be the master and when we will be a client of another system with real-time or asynchronous connections. In some cases, you'll also lead or assist with software development of custom features for the client that are 'must haves' before they can go live.

As a software engineer, you should be generally passionate about coding and have an interest in building applications with high usability, scalability, and test coverage. In your everyday work, you should continuously contribute to good overall software design with the goal to achieve a highly structured large scale software product. You should also maintain a high awareness of development industry trends and best practices.

In addition to your passion for coding, you should also want to help in other aspects of building a new company: Designing features, making good product decisions, and building a culture of excellence. We’re seeking engineers who are ready to attack deep technical challenges as well as have an impactful role in product and company development!
 

Key Responsibilities

  • Execute specific data migration tasks utilizing both manual and scripted processes

  • Develop and maintain web scrapers that can accurately pick up data elements and import them into the right database fields

  • Investigate legacy software products to figure out the best approach for data extraction

  • Implement a migration pipeline between two enterprise systems, likely using a data integration platform and in some cases a continuous syncing solution

  • Create individual data migration jobs to move portions data based on the needs of different customers go-live date

  • Write field-level transformation and validation code to allow data to flow reliably

  • Be responsible for verifying the pipeline is acting predictably: validate at each stage of migration, and generate reconciliation reports

Qualifications

  • Minimum 2 years of software implementation or technical solutions experience; knowledge of Ruby on Rails and AngularJS, a plus

  • Intermediate to expert proficiency with analysis and migration of SQL databases

  • Experience pipelining data in an imperfect environment—retrying through rate limits, http errors, network issues, etc.

  • Experience with agile software development environments

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, fluent in English
Apply now

About Source Coders

MyTime is a fully integrated scheduling, payments and automated marketing platform, specializing in large multi-location chains and franchises. Our mission critical software -- which includes in-store scheduling and online booking, client record management, email and SMS marketing, and a full point of sale for handling payments -- is used in every aspect of the customer journey. Our customers rely on their service businesses to remain competitive in the age of Amazon, and they need a next generation POS to help them achieve this growth. We aspire to be the “operating system” of their business.

We also made it easy to plug our online booking, payments and messaging capabilities into the places customers are found today, including Google Search, Facebook, Instagram, and the merchants’ own websites and mobile apps. Upon adopting MyTime, our customers see average revenue growth of up to 30% through improved operational efficiency, greater customer retention, and access to new customer acquisition channels.

Our product is used at over 14,000 locations across the globe, ranging from single-location sole proprietors to multi-billion dollar Fortune 500 chains.  As a completely cloud-based solution, MyTime is designed for quick and easy deployments. It’s lauded for its ease-of-use and short ramp-up time, having won numerous awards such as the Best Commerce Product of 2017 from the Local Search Association.

MyTime is backed by Upfront Ventures and Khosla Ventures and was founded by Ethan Anderson, a successful serial entrepreneur whose first startup, Redbeacon, won TechCrunch50 in 2009 and was acquired by The Home Depot.

Benefits

  • casual dress
  • private medical
  • uncapped commision
  • unlimited PTO
  • occasional work from home

Solutions Architect, Pre-Sales, Enterprise Networking, CCIE, Cisco R/S, SDN

A Leading Technology Solutions Provider specialized in deploying Security, Voice over IP, Cloud Solutions and other Advanced Networking solutions and services to regional & national Commercial, Healthcare and Enterprise clients has immediate needs for several Senior Pre-Sales Systems Engineers / Solutions Architects.

As the Senior Pre-Sales Solutions Architect, the candidate will be responsible for meeting with Commercial and Enterprise customers, collecting requirements for Core Networking Solutions relating to network projects and developing engineering Solutions for sale to customers. This is a technical sales support role for our account management team. Your ability to clearly articulate enterprise network solutions to our existing customer base and prospects is essential.

***This will be a Lead role for the region and offers the ability to work remotely from home when not in front of clients.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Remote from home when not in front of clients
- Opportunity to join a practice that is is rapid growth mode
- Competitive compensation packages
- Relocation assistance is offered!
- Work with established Cisco Gold Partners

What You Will Be Doing

The essential responsibilities of the Senior Systems Engineer are to work directly with customers and account managers in pre-sales situations, and to work effectively across functions with other employees in Sales, Marketing, Proposals, and Project Management areas. Specific responsibilities include:

- Perform as a Pre Sales Solutions Architect while also being the SME in Networking technologies for enterprise clients
- Meet with Customers and Collect Customer Requirements
- Work with Account Manager/Sales Team to develop customer relationship and Solutions and assist in overall sales process
- Create high-level solution designs/Architecture and present to customers
- Create Customer facing Presentations
- Create Bill of Materials & configurations for Solutions
- Build Scope of Services and Professional Service Pricing
- Write Statements of Work

What You Need for this Position

- Experience working as a Pre-sales Solution Architect or Cisco Sales Engineer
- 5+ years of experience in a network or solutions engineering level role that includes route/switch, Cisco wireless and Cisco Nexus
- Strong Pre Sales Experience
- Active CCNP and/ or CCIE certifications are highly desired
- Experience with Cisco Security, Data Center and/ or Collaboration are a plus
- Designing network solutions for enterprise customers
- Ability to deliver well-crafted and detailed Statements of Work
- Ability to deliver accurate Bills of Materials in short time frames
- Proven experience of successful solution selling
- Proven presentation and sales skills
- Must be able to quickly learn several products across a wide range of enterprise and data center networking technologies

What's In It for You

- Relocation Assistance!
- Competitive Base Salary (DOE)
- Work remote from home when no in front of clients
- Minimal travel
- Comprehensive Benefits Package
- PTO
- Opportunity for growth
- 401k
- Great work environment
- Other cool perks!If you are an experienced Sr. Network Solutions Architect, you are encouraged to apply ASAP or you can send your resume to me directly at

items.title: Workgrid Solutions Architect - Remote

items.content:
As an endeavor of Liberty Mutual, Workgrid Software is changing the way enterprise software is built. Our mission is to create beautiful purpose-built software that focuses on improving the employee experience.

At Workgrid, we believe employees should be productive, not busy. The amount of systems in today's business environment is overwhelming the workforce. Employees are overloaded with information, spending hours checking and managing their work, finding information, and taking action on menial tasks. This is causing significant communication and productivity issues in the workplace.

Workgrid focuses on creating solutions that solve the most common and inefficient workplace technology challenges faced by mid-large global businesses. Everything we do is because we believe people have a purpose. We create intuitive experiences that enable human potential by building software that people love.

Workgrid is actively seeking a Solutions Architect who will be responsible for developing a strong technical understanding of the Workgrid platform and leading the solution approach for onboarding external customers. Workgrid is on an AWS platform, node back end, serverless, multi-tenant, and global. Standards of SAML and OIDC are used. Microapps use web technologies such as HTML and JavaScript with a node backend. You will be the technical lead working with the customers technical lead to set up, deploy, provision, and connect the customers systems (modern SaaS to legacy) using web services such as REST and SOAP to create a meaningful and engaging employee experience.

You will also be responsible for establishing reusable patterns whenever possible and providing thought-leadership to the Product team, as well as product recommendations that enable the customers. Develop specifications for new features. Hands-on approach but may also mentor and guide other team members on the execution of the strategy. Identify and fill gaps to enable the customer to be self-sufficient on the platform. This could be through additional documentation or recommendations to the Product team on the core platform.

The actual internal level/grade for this role will depend on the candidates overall experience and skill level. Ability to Work Remote anywhere in the Continental United States.

About the role:

  • Technical Lead Architect who will develop the solution approach for onboarding new customers to the Workgrid platform.
  • Provide technical mentorship to the customer to teach them how to use the product and become self-sufficient.
  • Provides oversight on the execution of the architectural approach to onboarding customers. Influence and ensure solutions follow leading guidelines, are scalable, and whenever possible re-usable for other customers.
  • Designs and develops IT architecture (deployment, provisioning users, connectors) scalable solutions to business problems in alignment with the Workgrid architecture direction and standards.
  • Provides consultation and collaborates with Head of Product, CEO, and Head of Customer Success regarding long and short-range product features.
  • Recommends and drives innovative solutions, which anticipates the future direction of the business, its drivers and technology strategy.
  • Provides consultation on leveraging new and existing software and technology.
  • Leads teams, may have overall leadership responsibility for product architecture and design.
  • Reviews and ensures major architectural designs are consistent, maintainable, flexible and cost effective solutions.
  • Works with or leads technical teams to identify functional requirements that drive architecture and technology to meet customer needs and enables business capability.
  • Participates with application and infrastructure design architects to provide guidance for development and releases.
  • Develops strategies and architectures which support advanced security topics such as Vulnerability Lifecycle Management, Identity Management, Intrusion Detection, Authentication, Authorization and Auditing.
  • Consults with application development and infrastructure development teams to fit systems to architecture, and identify when it is necessary to modify the technical architecture to accommodate customer/stakeholder needs.
  • Responsible for prototyping complex, cross platform business solutions to validate newer technologies.
  • Recommends emerging scalable and reusable technical solutions to increase market share and reduce operational costs.
  • Analyzes the technology industry and market trends to determine potential impact on the business.
  • Influences technology direction and/or adjustments to incorporate into business plans.
  • Influences the selection of hardware and software product standards and the design of standard configurations; makes significant contributions to Product technology roadmaps and architectural principles and frameworks.
  • Develops and manages effective collaborative relationships with other departments, groups, peers, and subordinates (data mgmt., security, and infrastructure).
  • Leads retrospectives and defining opportunities for experiments and POCs.
  • Facilitates cross-team/train learnings, communication and alignment.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors or Masters degree in technical discipline; Masters preferred.
  • 10+ years of architecture experience in applications development in a complex, multi-platform distributed environment.
  • Extensive experience in layered solutions and designs, diverse technical configurations, across multiple technologies and processing environments.
  • In-depth knowledge in software engineering languages and tools; proficient in new and emerging technologies.
  • Extensive knowledge of all product and system components of technical architecture.
  • In-depth understanding of business operations, objectives and strategies including but not limited to, insurance industry, financial services, global business, architecture, technology trends, as well as security minded.
  • Strong leadership skills; coaching and mentoring skills. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills - including negotiation, facilitation, and consensus building skills; ability to influence and persuade, without direct control.
  • High degree of flexibility and ability to work with employees at all levels of the organization with diverse backgrounds.
  • Strong desire to drive change, and ability to adapt to change quickly. Strong consulting skills (relevant/technical); recognized as a thought leader within the company. Ability to balance the long-term "big picture" and short term implications of decisions.

Benefits:

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, its our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace an environment that is free from all discrimination in the workplace, in its business, or by its vendors. Liberty Mutual values diversity and the differences and similarities of our employees. We foster a diverse and inclusive work environment that leads to better ideas, stronger teams and more innovative products and services for our customers. Learn more

Liberty Mutual will consider for employment qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of federal, state, and local laws.

items.content:
My Team and I over at Nigel Frank International are working with a Microsoft Gold-Certified Consultancy to fill an Azure Application Architect position. This firm has recently been experiencing a large amount of growth in their application development projects, and want to move quickly to find highly skilled Architects to keep up with the demand.

This is a permanent, client-facing role that will require a solid 50-50% split of hands-on development work and leadership responsibilities. This role is ideal for candidates who want to assume a leadership position without losing the opportunity to work directly with tech.

Skills / Requirements:
-15+ years of experience working in development / architecture.
-At least the last 3 years working with Azure.
-PaaS focused background.
-Your most recent position must have been an Architecture role at a Consultancy.
-.NET, C#, Docker / Kubernetes, Python, Angular, JavaScript.
-Adept understanding of DevOps and Agile processes.

Candidates must be located in Dallas, TX. You will have the opportunity to work 100% remote from Dallas, with a light element of travel.

*Please note: this is a permanent role. All candidates must be either US Citizens or Green Card holders. Visa sponsorship is not provided.

This is a highly competitive, brand new job on the market. In order to fast-track your opportunity to secure an interview, please send your resume to Jordan at: [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] .

Jordan Hopf
Azure DevOps
Nigel Frank International
Email: [Click Here to Email Your Resum?]
Phone: (972)- (ext 7266)

  • Hands-on expertise working on CICD pipeline

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=10, other=0, dotnet=0, c=26, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=4, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=10, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=32, frontend=44}
items.content:
Solutions Architect (Ruby/Python/React) - Small Team, 100% Remote,Flexible Hours

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: DevOps
Industry: Internet of Things, Software Development / Engineering, Solar
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Reactions to this job

2 0 1 1 0 0
New! How do you feel about this job listing?
Company: Analytics Fire | No office location

Technologies

python
reactjs
ruby
javascript
devops

Job description

Analytics Fire builds custom software for the solar power industry. We’re looking for a collaborative but hands-on Solutions Architect to help us scale our execution to support additional new high-tech sectors.

Analytics Fire is a deeply technical engineering organization. Most of us are software engineers and spend the majority of our time on heads down engineering activities like coding. Our goal in creating this position is to expand our small client-facing team with a unique person that has both the personality and the technical skill set to collaborate directly with clients and senior members of the technical team in order to help steer technical decision making and requirements gathering, especially early in the project lifecycle.

This position is similar to that of a technical Program Manager, but you will be much more involved in the technical details and hurdles around software architecture than a traditional Project Manager would be. Our ideal candidate is a current or former full stack Software Engineer that is willing to be trained in formal Program Management processes (or has already been trained in formal Program Management processes).

As a small company, Analytics Fire is able to tailor roles around the strengths of our individual team members. We will tailor this role to your specific technical background. However, it is a hard requirement that you are able to support the following 3 types of responsibilities:

  • (a) Represent Analytics Fire software engineering teams in client-facing interactions (and sometimes interactions with potential clients)
  • (b) Technical writing responsibilities such as documenting requirements, project plans, system architecture, etc.
  • (c) Making meaningful contributions to the execution of complex software projects.

For reference, here is a list of some technologies we are currently actively using on a day-to-day basis:

  • JavaScript: React / Angular / Typescript / GraphQL
  • Back-end: Ruby / Python / Node
  • Embedded (IoT): C, Embedded Linux, MQTT
  • Embedded (robotics): C/C++, ROS
  • Modern software techniques: RESTful APIs, SOA, PaaS, etc
  • Agile collaboration and DevOps tools: Github, Trello, Slack, Chef, Ansible, Docker, Vagrant, etc
  • Other technologies we are currently building with: AWS, GCP, TensorFlow, OpenCV, Yocto, Salesforce platform, iOS, ARKit

Your primary responsibility will be to assist in guiding new projects through sales, planning, development, and deployment. This will be accomplished through a combination of client interactions, technical writing, and participation in formal sales, program management, and engineering related processes. Your contributions will naturally be slightly front-loaded towards the sales and planning phases, however you will remain deeply connected to each project through the entire lifecycle in order to ensure conceptual integrity is maintained from design to final implementation.

This is a remote position but is only open to candidates living in the US or Canada. We’re flexible about location and hours. We’re a really great match for candidate who wants to work hard on interesting projects, while also having flexibility around time and geography.

Skills & Requirements

“Must have” requirements:

  • 5+ years relevant hands-on experience as a full stack Software Engineer, DevOps engineer, or Site Reliability Engineer, ideally within a commercial startup environment.
  • Fluency around current modern best practices around software development and DevOps.
  • Soft skills necessary to navigate and negotiate with multiple teams, both internal and external to Analytics Fire.
  • Ability and willingness to familiarize yourself with our technical stack.
  • Superior organization and detail orientation.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Willingness to design, document, and evangelize new engineering processes to meet evolving organizational requirements.

“Nice to have” requirements:

  • Hands-on technical experience writing code in Ruby, Python, or JavaScript
  • Previous experience as a technical Program Manager.
Apply now

About Analytics Fire

Analytics Fire was founded by a couple of data-nerds -- one a PHd in machine learning and the other a former VP of Engineering for an analytics platform -- who both are also serial entrepreneurs backed by prominent angels and VCs including Y Combinator and 500 Startups.

“We founded Analytics Fire to create the engineering department that we always dreamed of working for. To us that means being able to spend our time working on interesting technical problems, while simultaneously having flexibility around time and geography and being part of a small, tightly-knit team of world-class engineers.”

Benefits

  • Remote
  • Flexible Schedule

items.content:
As an endeavor of Liberty Mutual, Workgrid Software is changing the way enterprise software is built. Our mission is to create beautiful purpose-built software that focuses on improving the employee experience.

At Workgrid, we believe employees should be productive, not busy. The amount of systems in today's business environment is overwhelming the workforce. Employees are overloaded with information, spending hours checking and managing their work, finding information, and taking action on menial tasks. This is causing significant communication and productivity issues in the workplace.

Workgrid focuses on creating solutions that solve the most common and inefficient workplace technology challenges faced by mid-large global businesses. Everything we do is because we believe people have a purpose. We create intuitive experiences that enable human potential by building software that people love.

Workgrid is actively seeking a Solutions Architect who will be responsible for developing a strong technical understanding of the Workgrid platform and leading the solution approach for onboarding external customers. Workgrid is on an AWS platform, node back end, serverless, multi-tenant, and global. Standards of SAML and OIDC are used. Microapps use web technologies such as HTML and JavaScript with a node backend. You will be the technical lead working with the customers technical lead to set up, deploy, provision, and connect the customers systems (modern SaaS to legacy) using web services such as REST and SOAP to create a meaningful and engaging employee experience.

You will also be responsible for establishing reusable patterns whenever possible and providing thought-leadership to the Product team, as well as product recommendations that enable the customers. Develop specifications for new features. Hands-on approach but may also mentor and guide other team members on the execution of the strategy. Identify and fill gaps to enable the customer to be self-sufficient on the platform. This could be through additional documentation or recommendations to the Product team on the core platform.

The actual internal level/grade for this role will depend on the candidates overall experience and skill level. Ability to Work Remote anywhere in the Continental United States.

About the role:

  • Technical Lead Architect who will develop the solution approach for onboarding new customers to the Workgrid platform.
  • Provide technical mentorship to the customer to teach them how to use the product and become self-sufficient.
  • Provides oversight on the execution of the architectural approach to onboarding customers. Influence and ensure solutions follow leading guidelines, are scalable, and whenever possible re-usable for other customers.
  • Designs and develops IT architecture (deployment, provisioning users, connectors) scalable solutions to business problems in alignment with the Workgrid architecture direction and standards.
  • Provides consultation and collaborates with Head of Product, CEO, and Head of Customer Success regarding long and short-range product features.
  • Recommends and drives innovative solutions, which anticipates the future direction of the business, its drivers and technology strategy.
  • Provides consultation on leveraging new and existing software and technology.
  • Leads teams, may have overall leadership responsibility for product architecture and design.
  • Reviews and ensures major architectural designs are consistent, maintainable, flexible and cost effective solutions.
  • Works with or leads technical teams to identify functional requirements that drive architecture and technology to meet customer needs and enables business capability.
  • Participates with application and infrastructure design architects to provide guidance for development and releases.
  • Develops strategies and architectures which support advanced security topics such as Vulnerability Lifecycle Management, Identity Management, Intrusion Detection, Authentication, Authorization and Auditing.
  • Consults with application development and infrastructure development teams to fit systems to architecture, and identify when it is necessary to modify the technical architecture to accommodate customer/stakeholder needs.
  • Responsible for prototyping complex, cross platform business solutions to validate newer technologies.
  • Recommends emerging scalable and reusable technical solutions to increase market share and reduce operational costs.
  • Analyzes the technology industry and market trends to determine potential impact on the business.
  • Influences technology direction and/or adjustments to incorporate into business plans.
  • Influences the selection of hardware and software product standards and the design of standard configurations; makes significant contributions to Product technology roadmaps and architectural principles and frameworks.
  • Develops and manages effective collaborative relationships with other departments, groups, peers, and subordinates (data mgmt., security, and infrastructure).
  • Leads retrospectives and defining opportunities for experiments and POCs.
  • Facilitates cross-team/train learnings, communication and alignment.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors or Masters degree in technical discipline; Masters preferred.
  • 10+ years of architecture experience in applications development in a complex, multi-platform distributed environment.
  • Extensive experience in layered solutions and designs, diverse technical configurations, across multiple technologies and processing environments.
  • In-depth knowledge in software engineering languages and tools; proficient in new and emerging technologies.
  • Extensive knowledge of all product and system components of technical architecture.
  • In-depth understanding of business operations, objectives and strategies including but not limited to, insurance industry, financial services, global business, architecture, technology trends, as well as security minded.
  • Strong leadership skills; coaching and mentoring skills. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills - including negotiation, facilitation, and consensus building skills; ability to influence and persuade, without direct control.
  • High degree of flexibility and ability to work with employees at all levels of the organization with diverse backgrounds.
  • Strong desire to drive change, and ability to adapt to change quickly. Strong consulting skills (relevant/technical); recognized as a thought leader within the company. Ability to balance the long-term "big picture" and short term implications of decisions.

Benefits:

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, its our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace an environment that is free from all discrimination in the workplace, in its business, or by its vendors. Liberty Mutual values diversity and the differences and similarities of our employees. We foster a diverse and inclusive work environment that leads to better ideas, stronger teams and more innovative products and services for our customers. Learn more

Liberty Mutual will consider for employment qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of federal, state, and local laws.

items.content:
Lead Solutions Engineer

Overview
With over 10,000 online merchants launching subscriptions and over 1,000,000 subscribers powered by ReCharge we're processing tens of millions of dollars in sales every week.  Our mission ‘to make repeat orders easier' began four years ago as a bootstrapped startup and today we're at the forefront of recurring billing software with over 100 remote-first employees around the globe.

As a Lead Solutions Engineer for our Solutions Engineering team, you’ll be responsible for planning and executing enterprise client migrations and driving value to our merchants through pre-sales engineering. You’ll work closely with sales and engineering teams to help merchants successfully launch onto the ReCharge platform.

What You’ll Do
  • Live by and champion our values: #ownership, #empathy, #simple-solutions.
  • Lead the planning and implementation of enterprise client migrations on to the ReCharge platform.
  • Manage and communicate detailed project plans and manage communication cadence.
  • Be a technical leader that drives project processes and technical projects to meet time sensitive deadlines.
  • Proactively identify potential issues and propose mitigation plans or alternative solutions.
  • Facilitate the definition of program scope, goals, and deliverables.
  • Educate merchants on proper store set-up.
  • Work with merchants' internal and 3rd party design and development teams.
  • Provide documentation and support during the set-up phase.
What You’ll Bring
  • Typically, 3-7 years of experience leading technical migrations at a SaaS company, or similar
  • Experience setting up basic API’s: know the difference between GET and POST request
  • Ability to influence Solutions Engineering team direction and take ownership of outcomes
  • Experience with ticketing platforms (Help Scout, Zendesk) and 3rd party apps desired
  • A basic proficiency with: Javascript, HTML, CSS (for debugging)
  • Familiarity with project/product management platforms (Asana, Jira)
  • Ability to communicate clearly in writing to both technical and non-technical people
  • Strong analysis, process, problem solving and critical thinking skills
  • Ability to work remotely and desire to make an impact at a boot-strapped start-up
  • Excellent communication skills, a team player with a ‘winning as a team’ attitude
  • Saas or billing/payments experience or start-up experience desired
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience desired

items.title: Solutions Architect
items.content:
Solutions Architect

United Kingdom, London
Company: BlackCat

Overview

Overview

The Solutions Architect provides technical servant leadership within the organisation, and owns the technical aspects of relationships with customers.The Solutions Architect will work closely with the Chief Architect to develop and deliver each engagement’s key strategic objectives.

An outgoing, confident and collaborative individual, the Solutions Architect will consult with both internal and external stakeholders, and take ownership of designing and scaling solutions for our clients.The Solutions Architect will be involved in providing technical and architectural oversight to teams.

This role will require a certain amount of travel to BlackCat HQ in Birmingham as well as customer offices.We would aim to keep travel to around 2-3 days per week, but flexibility will be required from time to time.

Key responsibilities

  • Liaise with technical stakeholders to ensure enterprise and architectural patterns and processes are followed and to participate in development and evolution of architecture;

  • Contribute to the development of technical standards;

  • Research and assess established and emerging tools and technologies to support the business needs;

  • Support the development squads’technical needs and queries;

  • Help resolve complex technical issues;

  • Help to foster a culture of continuous improvements and innovation;

  • Empower squads to be accountable and responsible for their own actions and decisions.

Technical Stack / Required hard skills

  • Deep knowledge of at least one modern programming language and software engineering best practices;

  • Knowledge of modern technologies, frameworks and methodologies, for example:

    • Public, Private and Hybrid Cloud environments;

    • Cloud Native technologies and techniques;

    • Data Analytics and Big Data projects in data-centric organisations;

  • Strong Agile framework experience and exhibits positive agile behaviours;

  • Excellent problem-solving ability including leading teams to identify, research and coordinate resources to diagnose and troubleshoot complex issues.

Required soft skills

  • A strong and confident communicator, able to remain proactive and engaged with their team in a largely remote situation;

  • Ability to work across multiple projects at any one time;

  • A strong team player able to interact positively and supportively with a team of peers, to produce the solution that is right for the team;

  • A self-starter with a constant ethos of self-improvement;
